description:
Saffron Grill came highly recommended to me by my boyfriend's old roommate who is Indian. According to his roomie, it's authentic Indian food at a great price. While I don't know what authentic Indian food tastes like, I can say all the items we ordered at Saffron were very delicious and yummy. 

My boyfriend and I got delivery through Yelp, so I can't really comment on service or atmosphere. I will say their Tikka Masala is one of the most flavorful ones I've had yet. There were huge chunks of chicken in our Tikka Masala. We also got the Lamb Korm which tasted a bit plain in comparison to the Tikka Masala, but still tasty nonetheless. You will definitely taste the lamb in this curry. 

Glad my boyfriend lives so close to Saffron. I can definitely see us ordering from here again and again :)
author: Angela W.

description:
This place is the worst Indian place I have been to in the Bay Area. And you have to trust me, since I'm from New Delhi. We reached the place at 7:30 for dinner, placed the order in by 7:45 -- all nice and smooth till this point.

At around 8:15 I started to get suspicious: the restaurant was super crowded and almost everyone who came in after us had either already picked up their order, or had their food out. I spent the next 15 mins trying to get attention of the two servers, almost comically at times, till one of them finally obliged. I asked her if there was any hope the food will come out soon, and well, she asked me to repeat the entire order. My suspicion is that that's when the kitchen finally started preparing the food, and it took another 20 mins for it to come out.

In a nutshell, they got so busy getting the food out to uber eats and doordashes that they just threw our order slip away, and made us 3 hungry innocents wait over an hour. I've never left a zero tip in my life, but I guess there's a first time for everything.

PS: in case you were wondering about food itself, don't bother. It was cold, the naans were cold and hard, and it just seemed like the tray got put in a forgotten corner in the kitchen for 45 mins before someone found it.
author: Anant J.

description:
HIGHLY recommended by an often homesick, very picky Indian. If you want authentic Indian food, this is one of the two places in SF you want to go. The other is Kennedy's, which is also connected to pub.

Saffron does not have a bar, though it does have beer and wine. It's a small and no-frills restaurant - the vibe is also authentic.

Warning: spicy food here is VERY spicy. I typically eat pretty spicy, and opt for mild to medium here.
author: Niyati D.

description: I was unfortunately disappointed with the food here after reading the rave reviews. I ordered the malai kofta. While the food did have a nice spicy kick, they over salted the dish to the point that it's all I could taste. The naan was ok. Picking up was a little confusing as there was no one at the front when I walked in either. The lady that helped me finally was kind, so I'll bump up my review a star for her :)
author: Shelby B.

description: Stopped in for dinner on a weekday. This is not a big place. Small room with about 8-9 tables? But the food is very delicious! Friendly waitstaff and they bring the food out pretty quick! We had the garlic nan bread. Delicious! I ordered the paneer tiki masala. Very delicious! The portion are just right for one person. The lentil soup was very good but I wouldn't order again unless I was craving lentils.
author: Jo L.

description:
Saffron Grill: a quaint and cozy restaurant with absolutely delicious Indian food at reasonable prices. I will definitely be back. 

I found Saffron Grill many months ago through Doordash (I think) and have been getting it delivered to me a couple times a month since. The food was generally wonderful, although the nan that we ordered occasionally came a bit burned. After enjoying take-out for so long, I decided to check out the real restaurant. We ordered the chicken tikka masala, white rice, and the garlic nan and were pleasantly surprised when we were given a chip-like appetizer (maybe poppadum?) with sauces. Everything was absolutely delicious, even more delicious than we expected, and the chicken tikka masala was to die for. The only thing I might complain about was that the soda was bottled and not on tap. 

The service was great and the restaurant seemed very personal: there was only room for maybe 30 people to sit. 

Lastly, the prices were super reasonable. For two very filling meals, I think it was close to $25 including tip.
author: Kristin A.

description: A small restaurant off the beaten path with super flavorful food, good portions, and reasonable prices! The tandoori chicken was well seasoned and everything was fresh, 5 stars for sure
author: Stephanie S.

description: I ordered their chicken biryani and it was so disappointing. The chicken was very dry. Furthermore it seemed like the marination was just curry powder. The spice level was meh. Overall a disappointing meal.
author: Dhruv M.

description: David my friend invited me for dinner at Saffron Grill. It's a small space, but quaint. I had the chicken biryani and it was okay, but maybe I didn't love it because I only had a third. I liked the samosa. We had cucumber sauce. David had fish tandoori and he says he gets that a lot. We had mango lassi's and their lassi was good. The service was very nice. It was a nice atmosphere. It got very quiet by 8:30.
author: Denise C.

description: Tasteless Indian food. The food looks good but taste is messed up. The flavor and right mix of spices of missing. It is a dark stuffy restaurant which does not help. Looks to be popular with takeout.
author: Don S.

description: I stopped into Saffron Grill last night on a whim. I was craving Indian food & it's like 3 blocks from my work. It's a very small restaurant, and you might miss it driving past if you blink, so don't blink! Everything was delicious!! I over-ordered, but that's not a bad thing. The raita was thicker/creamier & more flavorful than I've ever had! The naan also was fluffier than I've ever had! I would go back alone for that if the dishes I order were okay. But they weren't just okay, they were great! I only wished the Navratan Korma had more nuts, but that seriously was the only thing that I wished were different during the meal. Maybe I'll ask for extra cashews next time?
author: Suki J.

description: Wonderful food.... out of this world honestly. It's a small, converted space that really gives you a neighborhood vibe. Would recommend Chana masala.
author: Suzanne Q.

description:
YUM!

did my work holiday party lunch here. about 25 peeps, a mix of omnis. veggies, vegans & gluten-free. they accommodated us all. super tasty, little bit oily, but very fresh. friendly service. TINY place- at 25, we took over the whole joint. they gave us free dessert :)
author: Virginia D.

description:
I'm actually appalled that I've yet to review Saffron Grill because it has long been one of my neighborhood favorites. In the past two weeks, I've been five times. It is literally that good.

I love so many things about Saffron Grill, but some of the highlights are the free papadum, vegetarian-friendliness (I love meat, but I can always happily find vegetarian dishes I'm willing to share with my vegetarian friends), generous portions (the dishes don't look very big, but size is deceiving. I've never actually finished my food), and always-hot-and-fresh-and-delicious-and-perfect garlic naan. I've loved every dish I've tried, though my ideal meal at Saffron Grill would consist of chicken tikka, sag paneer, and a basket overflowing with their divine garlic naan.

See you there. Literally. Because chances are, if you're there, I am too.
author: Kelly R.

description:
2.5 STARS

I was a little delicate from going out the night before. Since I had a disappointing lunch, I decided to get my comfort food for dinner. Indian! I ordered delivery through UberEats on Friday, April 14th at 7:33pm. It arrived at 8:13pm. I live in Outer Richmond.

*Vegetable Samosa: two pieces, puff pastries filled with potatoes, sweet peas, herbs, and spices ($6.75)
*Garlic Nan: fresh chopped garlic layered nan ($3.50)
*Chicken Tikka Masala: boneless chicken in a moderately spiced, garlic, and tomato base sauce ($13.50)

The samosas were good. Soft on the inside and crispy outside. I enjoyed them with the mint chutney. The chicken tikka masala had a nice consistency. (I had a super thin curry earlier.) But I wanted more heat and flavor. I had noted extra spicy with my order and it didn't have much heat. The curry was creamy, but where were the levels of flavor? I found it very mild and one note. The garlic naan had a good amount of garlic, but it was too thick and doughy. I prefer my naan with more of a chew. This was very soft.

Okay place to get Indian for delivery, but I found them too pricey. Almost $7 for samosas and $14 for curry?! No thank you! Glad I checked another place off my list, but I probably won't be ordering from them again.
author: Elena N.

description:
Ordered delivery from here and I was pretty happy with my order. Got the butter chicken, malai kofta, naan, and raita. 

I loved the butter chicken, raita, and naan combo and would absolutely order it again. Be warned though- the butter chicken is more tomato-y and chunky than creamy and is on the sweeter side. Personally I really liked this and it was one of my favorite indian dishes I have had in San Francisco. Would absolutely order again. It has a good amount of chicken and while it didn't look huge, ended up being almost 3 meals. Definitely get the raita with this- the yogurt compliments the tomato nicely and it's a delicious combination. 

The malai kofta was less enjoyable- I found it a bit too spicy and I have had much better versions of that dish for sure. I would avoid this in the future myself but people who like spicier food might like it. 

Delivery was on time and food was packed nicely and labeled. Initially prices seemed to be on the higher side but the portions are on the more generous side and quality was solid. This is probably gonna be my go to Indian delivery spot now.
author: Seema U.

description:
We were at Alamo Square Park and decided we wanted Indian food and found this little gem within walking distance.

The space is very cozy, the food was delicious and reasonably priced.  The waitress/owner was very helpful. We ordered the vegetable samosas, vegetable pakora, Bindhi Masala, Prawn Biryani, Chicken Tikka Masala, and Tandoori Fish. Everything was tasty. We would definitely return again.
author: Sherry H.

description: I went with friends after a long day of hiking - we were looking to find some filling, good Indian food. Sad to say, saffron grill was quite disappointing. The prices are fairly steep and the quantity is below average. For comparison, if you order a rice with a standard curry, you will not have enough curry to finish the bowl of rice. In terms of the food itself, I got the malai kofta and it was subpar/OK at best, the koftas felt frozen and as if they were just tossed into the mix. In a nutshell, the prices do not justify the food you get, and I'd recommend exploring other options - the competition of other Indian places along Market street is just far better.
author: Manthan S.

description:
This is one of those places I have been reluctant to review because, while I wish them great success, I don't want to overshare about my favorite hidden gems and then not be able to get a table. 

This is one of my favorite restaurants, period. When I have guests who I really care about, I take them here for dinner, and nobody has ever been disappointed. 

I was desperately upset when they "closed for renovations" a few years back, and were gone for 10 months. I thought they were gone for good. And then: surprise! They came back, as good as ever! It was like a miracle. 

My single complaint: the tandoori fish special is no longer trout. That tandoori trout was like the best thing ever. Last two times I had it it was two different kinds of fish, both still excellent, but that trout was a miracle. Bring back the tandoori trout, please!
author: David K.

description: This place is tasty! While it's small so if you get take out, you'll have to wait outside, I highly recommend it! You could also eat there, but my friends live nearby, so we just get it to go.
author: Dani S.

description: I only went to this place because I was in the neighborhood, and based on the types of flavors I enjoy, it looked like my ideal spot. I arrived there a bit early, and patiently waited outside. Being alone, I was fortunate enough to strike up a conversation with some other folks waiting in line, and the four of us ended up dining together. Let me just say I was impressed with the atmosphere and service - super friendly staff. I ordered the chicken tikka masala and garlic naan - it was phenomenal. I can't wait to go back and try another dish, there were so many on the menu. Can't wait fo was my next visit. Thanks Saffron Grill A+!!!!!
author: Ryan P.

description: I am a long-time resident of the neighborhood of Saffron Grill. I had only recently started to order takeout from them, and I absolutely loved their tandoori chicken and their shrimp curry. However there was one dish that I was not happy with and when I explained why I wasn't happy I was given a replacement dish and it was absolutely delicious. I am very grateful that they listened to me and did their best to make it right. I am even happier that I can order from them with full confidence!
author: Leslie C.

description:
Went there for my birthday a week or so ago and had a great experience!

Food: We ordered the saag lamb, lamb achar and some garlic naan. Take it from me because I sustain on restaurant bought Indian food that their food tastes authentic! We had asked the lamb achar to be spicy but my cousin found it too spicy for her so they offered raita without additional cost! The saag lamb was thick but not too creamy sweet and despite the heat I could taste the spices and flavors of the achar lamb very well. The owner's wife told us that they cook in small batches and we could tell that the food tasted fresh and was not just seeped in oil to cover the staleness as many restaurants tend to make it. I am always surprised at how restaurants get naan wrong despite using a proper tandoor but their naan was on point! We finished off with gulab jamun on the house for my birthday which was a very sweet gesture!   

Service: We came in around closing time but they happily took us in on a Sunday night and even started trying to help us with our tricky parking situation. The staff worked well with each other (seemed like they're treated well by the owner and this is important) and we chatted quite a bit with them too about different Indian and Nepali pop-ups and festivals. They seem to get a lot of takeout orders but people really need to come for their service. Felt like we were guests in their home. 

Nothing to complain about at all!
author: Sadia I.

description:
I first tried Saffron Grill during one of the Giants' World Series games. My friend and I couldn't get into any sports bars, and we were hungry, so Indian food it was.

I think the best way to describe the restaurant is "charming". It's a small, family-run place where (I think) the dad cooks, the mom manages, and the daughter is the hostess. This might have changed but that's the impression I got. And I'm going to continue to mention them as such because I like the idea of a family owned and operated business.

My friend ordered some food (it doesn't really matter what), and I ordered vindaloo, asking for it "as spicy as you can make it". The waitress/daughter asked if I was sure, and I told her emphatically that yes, I want it to be as spicy as possible.

The food came, and it was good. Maybe 3/5 to 4/5. Nothing crazy, but very solid and if I recall correctly we were a bit tipsy. The main point though, was that it wasn't that spicy. The manager/mom and waitress/daughter seemed a little amused and promised if I came back, they would make it spicy.

Fast forward a year, and I live nearby! Amazing. I came back with two friends and asked "hey, do you remember me?" They did! And they said they would make something spicy for me.

I'll quickly wrap this up - they made it MORE spicy, but not what I consider spicy. I told them this, and this time they seemed a little perplexed. Whatever, I know that I don't look like someone who can handle high heat, but I think they got the idea that medium spicy was mild for me.

Now fast forward a month. I come in, and as soon as they see me, they say the chef/dad is going to make something special for me. Yay! My friends order normal food.

This time, I got a little scared. I could hear the chef/dad coughing, a lot, as he was cooking. My friends were also joking about this being my last meal.

The food comes out, and for the first time the chef/dad comes out too, and he's looking at me. The manager/mom and waitress/daughter sit down a few tables away, and they are looking at me too. In addition, the waitress/daughter brings out a small plate of dark red powder, and says "this is from the chef in case you want it more spicy". Was this habañero powder? Ghost pepper powder? Something else? I don't know, but it had a brownish-red color that looked pretty evil.

I take my first bite, and realize that these people now meant business. My head started sweating, my nose started running, my eyes started watering, and I could feel the heat even before the spiciness hit. Which it did, pretty hard.

Now, I can handle spicy food. Better than most, and I only say "most" because while I logically know that there must be some people who enjoy spicier food than me, I haven't ever met them. On my scale, I would say this food was 4/5 spicy. I've had hotter food, but this was definitely in the "pain is pleasure" category, and I couldn't taste anything besides heat.

So the whole family is watching me take a few bites, my faithless friends are waiting for me to cry uncle (as opposed to just crying, which it probably appeared like I already was). What do I do? Start spooning in the hot pepper powder of course!

So basically, once food gets this hot where it hurts and you're basically having an endorphin rush, a little extra heat isn't going to do much. And I was not going to let this family think they had beat me, nor give my friends the satisfaction of seeing me leave the plate unfinished and curl into a ball with a gallon of mango lassi.

I ate every drop of the curry, and I used the entire plate of powder they gave me. The family looked incredulous. My friends shook their heads, in what I will call amazement.

Sitting there afterwards, feeling proud of myself for tolerating what would kill most people (that's how I choose to think about it), I couldn't help but feel an intense satisfaction. Because I am masochistically addicted to spicy food, I guess.

To conclude though, I have eaten non-spicy food here, and it's good for Indian food. The place is clean, the service is good, and the people are nice. And it's family run! Or again, at least that's how I choose to think of it. And any place that will risk killing someone just to satisfy a patron's bizarre love of painfully spicy food deserves an extra star in my book. I don't live nearby anymore so unfortunately I can't visit, but anyone in the area definitely should check them out.
author: Sm L.

description:
Ordered delivery on a Friday night through Eat24. The order arrived half an hour late and one of the items (Chicken Tikka Masala) was incorrect, so I can't speak to how it tasted. Not sure what they delivered instead, but it looked like some kind of vindaloo and was way too spicy. Malai Kofta sauce was too thick and Navratan Curry was only so-so. Keema Naan was a weird scary purple color. Rice was decently cooked, but utterly bland and uninteresting with no peas or spices. The only bright point was the samosa, which somehow remained light and crispy. Will not order from here again.

Ordered: Assorted Pakora and Samosa appetizer, Chicken Tikka Masala, Malai Kofta, Navratan Curry, Keema Naan
author: Bronwen A.

description: Saffron Grill is my favorite takeout Indian, perhaps my favorite overall takeout in the city. Amazing curries and delicious naan. I especially like the chicken korma and the garlic and kabuli naan. Make sure you order extra tamarind sauce, because it is freaking delicious, especially with the samosas. Thanks for being so tasty!!
author: Amelia Q.

description: Don't miss this little gem....excellent!!!! Saffron Grill is by far, the best Northern Indian food we've had this side of the pond!
author: Jay K.

description: Great staff! Very clean restaurant! The food is fabulous! We had buttered chicken & Chicken Tikka Masala cooked to perfection.
author: Cristina G.

description: It's so conveniently located yet can be hard to find if you weren't looking for it. The space is very cozy and warm. The ambiance feels like it's really good for catching up with old friends as it's got that comfort, intimate yet casual vibe. As we catch up, we definitely ordered way too much food with curries, naan, lassis, paneer, etc. All the foods were very flavorful and meshed well too. By the end, I was very happily satiated.  The wait staff is very catering, warm, and welcoming.My friend knew the servers well since he's been coming here for years. The service can be slow at times, but it's more about enjoying the conversations and this is the perfect place to do just that!
author: Lana W.

description: Delicious food!! I was served right away and loved the chicken tikka masala chicken. The naan was fantastic. Perfect for an intimate dinner with friends
author: Kayle R.

description: My absolute favorite Indian restaurant in the bay. It could be slow at times but the service is always exceptional. They bring out this amazing flatbread for free called papadum and I could not stop eating them. It is so good. And they will give you some more if you ask. Also, the food. I've been to several great Indian spots in San Francisco and this is by far the best one!
author: J A.

description:
Favorite Indian place in the city. Food so fresh and curries are made to order. Family owned and run you can taste the tradition and warmth in their dishes. I honestly wish I ate here more and will make a more concerted effort to do so. 

Papadum are thing and crispy! Okra and eggplant are not stand out dishes. They were specials the night I went and were some of the best I've ever had. We also got the prawn and coconut curry which had great coconut flavor and lots of shrimp!  Go here. You will not be disappointed!!
author: Sam L.

description:
Delicious!

Food was fresh and perfect for the taste. The service was pretty fast, friendly and welcoming. It'd be more satisfactory as long as you stick to traditional Punjabi menu and not go off course to include Biryanis in your order! 

A definite five stars for Assorted Appetizer. Samosas crispy from outside and soft from inside. The vegetable pakoras were good enough for two people with a decent appetite. The mint chutney adds an extra taste to it.

Thumbs up for Paneer Makhani and Garlic Naan. It's been a long time since I had such a yummy Paneer Curry. We asked for a medium spicy curry and it was cooked as expected; a little sweet and little spicy. Serving it with soft Garlic Naan made it even better.

We wanted to try our luck with Vegetable Biryani considering how very few places actually serve a Vegetable Hyderabadi Biryani. Also, the menu says Vegetable Biryani(not Hyderabadi Biryani) so its kind of implied. It turned out to be a sticky Veg Pulao with added spices fried to look and taste like Biryani. So if you are in for a Veg Pulao, I'd say go for it.
author: Pavitra K.

description: I have been coming here frequently for the past year (since it is conveniently located a mile and a half from my office) and I've noticed the service sucked after each visit.  My waitress was busy hiding in the kitchen eating dinner herself while my cup of water was never refilled; the only single seating in the restaurant had a table that was wobbly.  Only positive thing is the food, which is very flavorful.  The amount I got for $13 was quite overhanded, not to mention, it took about 20 minutes for it to come.  I think this place cares more about customers on Uber Eats than those who dine in, as I see food being cranked out for delivery, but never food for the actual patrons who made the effort to show up.
author: Chris A.

description:
Love Saffron Grill! This delicious hole-in-the-wall is a Divisadero treasure. The restaurant is tiny, maybe 7 tables total, and sometimes the service is a bit slow, but it's worth it. Food is delicious, portions generous, price a steal!

Been a handful of times and never a disappointment. Do remember to order rice if you want it with your main though, as it's not included.

Favorites: 
Aloo paratha, keema naan (all of naan are great)
Butter chicken, chicken tikka masala
Lamb vindaloo, lamb saag
Lamb biryani

Definitely worth a visit if you're in Nopa!
author: Cindy T.

description:
I'd give 4.5 stars if I could! 

My go-to Indian restaurant in the city. It's small in the way of seating, but has a warm and cozy vibe meant for dining with friends or on a date. The service has always been great, very friendly and accommodating and provides good recommendations. I'm unfortunately allergic to gluten which is no problem here - my go to items:

Papadum - great flavor and crispy texture, I love the sauces that come with it
Pickles - definitely an acquired taste but my British boyfriend approves and likens them to the "lime pickle" he orders at home
Vegetable pakora - lots of different veggies in a chickpea batter
Raita - creamy and cuts spice
Saag paneer - my favorite in the city... do they use cloves? Cinnamon? I'm uneducated on what this should taste like but love the flavor and consistency here
Tikka masala - I opt for medium and it's definitely pretty spicy
Butter chicken - good, but less flavorful than the tikka
Tandoori chicken - good for a lighter option but not lacking in spice 

It's pretty consistent with San Francisco cost, maybe a bit more expensive than I'd like but not highway robbery. For the quality, I think it's fair. I've never left hungry but they don't give IHOP portions.

Delivery is great too! All in all, I hope Saffron Grill is around a long time because every time I suggest it, everyone is in.
author: Darcy D.

description: Love this place, I order delivery at least twice a month from here. Love the saag paneer, navratan korma, butter chicken, coconut curry chicken, garlic naan and vegetable samosas!
author: Sarah J.

description: I love this restaurant.  I live around the corner and come here at least once a month, and have for years.  The staff is delightful (Bimala, Santosh, and the whole gang), and the food is delicious.  It's not too heavy, and is so flavorful.  I love the saag paneer, chicken tikka masala, malai kofta curry, and baigan bharta.  The chicken achar is also fantastic.  Try the Laurier pinot noir for a nice glass of red.
author: Josh W.

description:
Hi 
This is unbelievable, ur waitress not only racist, she is a liar as well. 

1- I didn't order to go, I order to dine in.
2- I ask her in which table I sit , she suggest the table and I sit.
3- the manager or the supervisor who told me people don't like to sit in front of the restroom..... where she moved me. 
4- u said u watch a video, watch it again and u will see that the customer next to my first table ( a girl ) watch and listen to everything and she's really surprised, I have a witness to the whole story , I am not a liar .... your waitress is a liar and racist and the manager as well.
author: Assaad A.

description: Excellent service with wonderful Indian food.  They use great ingredients and have a great Indian style.   They have some great South Indian food.  Very friendly staff there.
author: Thomas P. L.

description: Excellent lunch and great value. Lunch specials come with rice, Naan, lentils, mixed vegetables and your main entree---Plenty of food! Malai Kofta was sweet and creamy.  Saag Paneer was tasty and herby, chicken Tikka Masala delicious.  Naan was very fresh and soft.  Service fine, cozy place!
author: Pamela J.

description: I was really excited to try this place, due to the great reviews and proximity to my house. I ordered takeout (pickup) and got Sag Paneer and Chicken Tikka Masala. The portions were small for the price, and rice/naan were not included. There was not much chicken or paneer in either dish, and the chicken tikka masala was not very flavorful. I was disappointed, but will likely be back to try more dishes. The restaurant is quaint and intimate, and the staff I interacted with were very friendly.
author: Karenna B.

description: This is really good Indian food.  We ate in the restaurant  We had half an order of Tandoori Chicken, Sag Paneer and the Naan with potatoes and peas. Everything was excellent and plentiful.
author: Richard Y.

description:
I would give this place 4 stars for the flavor of the food. It's a solid Indian food joint with very authentic food. However, the service was slow, it was a pretty small/cramped restaurant, and the waitress struggled to answer our questions regarding the drink menu. 

We got two chicken tikka masalas- one regular and one "medium hot" and a chicken masala. I got the medium hot tikka and it was plenty spicy for me and I can handle spice. My boyfriend on the other hand got the regular tikka and was dying of heat - to each their own :)

I took a bite of the chicken (no tikka) masala and it had great flavor too. Not as hot as the tikka. 

I did get an awful stomach ache after this meal. I don't blame the meal preparation, I believe it was a combo of overeating and spiciness. Regardless I think I'll take a break from Indian food for a while.  

All this plus 2 sides of rice, garlic naan for 3, and 3 beers it came out to $75 + tip.
author: Kelly G.

description: Flavorful, yet not swimming in cream. Somehow, they managed to capture a perfect palette of seasoning without adding unnecessary cream, in fact less! I ordered saag paneer & chicken tikka masala. The chicken had a great Smokey flavor. Door Dash didn't do the food service. I recommend you use grub hub & request rice. Ohhh, the garlic nann was fluffy & delicious!
author: Syrah A.

description:
Awesome place, so yummy and their lunch special is great deal!  Lunch combo entrees start at $10 for vegetarian entrees and include rice, naan, a lentil soup and saag curry or some other vegetable curry.  On the weekends, they also serve unlimited chai with lunch, but that's not the case on weekdays. 

It's a quiet place, I suspect they do a lot of business through food delivery, but the dining room is clean, pleasant and well decorated.

They make wonderful curries, starting with the standard Tikka Masala to things like the Kashmiri Ghost.  I highly recommend the Kashmiri Ghost or the regular Chicken Curry (a less milky and cloying version of the Tikka)
author: Alice S.

description: The worst Indian food I've eaten in my life. The Chicken Tikka Masala that I ordered was nothing like Chicken Tikka Masala. It was a red chunky sauce that looked and tasted more like spaghetti sauce and probably wasn't even made with ghee. I had high hopes for this place but am really shocked at how poor quality the food is.
author: Steven M.

description: This is my favorite Indian food in SF. They are always happy to accommodate my vegetarian requests. My favorite is their vindaloo. Staff is always friendly and prices are fair.
author: Elvia D.

description:
Awesome indian restaurant. 

Small cozy restaurant just off divisidero with DELICIOUS food. 
It can be a bit noisy inside because it is a small space but feels like you are in someones home eating delicious home cooked indian food.
Chicken Tikka Masala is the best. The sauce is absolutely amazing.
author: Jean Marie C.

description: One of the most high quality Indian restaurants in the city. I love the vegetable briyani and kufta.
author: Yasmeen A.

description: Lamb saag, aloo gobi and garlic naan are my go to Indian dishes. I've had them at a lot of restaurants. This was some of the best I've had.
author: Jasper P.

description: The saag paneer paired with roti was incredible!  This place is a hole in the wall that would be easy to pass by, but we are so glad we went.
author: Linda G.

description: Loved it. Want to go back.  Chicken tikka masala was delicious.  Lamb bohti was ok- a little sour tasting, but it came out of the kitchen sizzling- great presentation.  Place is cozy.
author: R G.

description:
We ordered take-out (they don't deliver) from Saffron Grill for the first time yesterday, and as a connoisseur of Indian cuisine I was hoping for a delicious meal and decent portions. Saffron Grill did not disappoint! We ordered all vegetarian dishes: alloo gobi (potato and cauliflower), chana masala (chick peas), yellow dal (lentils), and sag paneer (spinach and cheese cubes). We also ordered naan (flat bread).

At pickup, the food was piping hot. Every dish was absolutely delicious, a perfect mixture of flavor and spiciness (all dishes ordered mild). Oftentimes, bean dishes at many restaurants are either under- or over-cooked. Saffron Grill's chana and dal were cooked to perfection!

Totaling $60, the four entree dishes and three (large and delicious!) pieces of naan (plus rice I cooked at home) fed 4 hungry adults and 2 kids with leftovers. I think my 2 year old ate as much as I did! Thank you, Saffron Grill for letting me off the hook for dinner, in such a delicious way! We will be back!!
author: Christina S.

description:
My favorite Indian restaurant in the city. Delicious food, homey interior, and nice staff. I didn't ask but it feels like a family run place.

I've ordered delivery from them as well and it showed up 20 minutes earlier than expected. All around great experience!
author: Kevin D.

description:
I love how the restaurant fits into the vibe of the Hayes/Haight culture. Very small restaurant seats probably around 20-25 people. This restaurant has one of the most flavorful indian food but it is not greasy at all. They do a really good job in making it health conscious and tasteful. 

WATCH OUT the spicy level tend to be much higher than an average restaurant in SF. The medium level is quite spicy and will keep chugging few glasses of water.

Please get the garlic naan if you are there it is so good and blends well with the food. The chicken tikka masala was great and not creamy (perfect combination).

Enjoy great food and service!
author: Kunal T.

description:
Best Indian food in the city, hands down. Bimala and her waitstaff are simply the sweetest. Highly recommend anything from the tandoori oven, saag paneer, naan, biryani, and everything else on the menu. 

You can't go wrong with this place, sit down or delivery. 

Stop wasting your time anywhere else and choose to eat at this local family owned restaurant. It truly is the greatest. :)
author: Rob M.

description: Place is a zoo! Small, over crowded, and beset with pick up/delivery orders. If you ever go on-site, you could be waiting for an hour! And all that wait might have been worthwhile if the food had been finger licking good, but it isn't and so we felt cheated and unfulfilled. The service was also poor.
author: Sam M.

description: I ordered medium spicy  Biryani and it was super super spicy. Every spoon I had to drink water. And I know how spicy I eat, it wasn't Medium
author: Ramesh A.

description: OH YELP, Sometimes your ratings are so off. I'm finding it hard to even say anything positive about this spot. First off the only thing that was good was the Nan. Butter chicken? Hardly! It was overly sweet with very small pieces of shredded chicken, the worst I've ever had. Thier  Baingan Bharta (daily special) was very bland, and quite slimy and absolutley no smoked/roasted flavor on the eggplant. This is one of my usual favorite dishes but not here.. like others have mentioned they seemed more focused on their brisk takeout business than thier dine in guests.  We orderd a large beer with the meal to share which was poured incredibly sloppily, and the server almost walked off without even giving us the last quarter of the bottle. After beer was served we didn't get any further service untill we had to shout into the kitchen to ask for the check.  Overall very mediocre food combined with poor service means we wont be back. So many other indian restaurants get right what this place fails at.
author: Raphael P.

description: Very yummy! Our go to place for good Indian Food. It's fresh and delivered pleasantly and super fast!
author: Chris C.

description: Service is excellent and the naan is fresh and delicious! I also love all the vegetarian dishes, I can eat what I want here
author: Veronica L.

description: Small place.  Mostly 2 tops.  Very good indian food.  A little expensive,  but probably in line with pricing in San Francisco.   I'd happily eat here again.
author: Noel Y.

description:
I had the Chicken Tikka Masala (boneless chicken in a moderately spiced, garlic and tomato base sauce) and the Lamb Achar (pickled boneless lamb with hot and tangy sauce - in house specialty) and they were a good time.  They look just like the pictures.  The flavor and seasoning was great and I recommend them and would definitely order them again.  The place is casual and there isn't much eye candy in terms of interior design, so make sure you go with friends and/or chatty people.  The staff were attentive and friendly.

The only slight that occurred was I asked them to make my dishes super spicy and it didn't happen.  After the tikka masala came out and it wasn't the spice level that I asked for, I really impressed upon and communicated to them that I want the lamb achar to be extra extra extra spicy.  The waitress & waiter took my order and told the chef/cook in the back about my request and...it's not clear too me if the chef/cook refused or they didn't have the spices to make it spicy because there was some yelling in the back.  It seems my request made someone mad....I'm really not sure.  Anyhow, it wasn't the spice level I wanted, but it's fine.  The above paragraph is my preference and shouldn't be interpreted as a negative as everything else was lovely.  I really liked the dishes the food was served in.
author: Shaun W.

description: I stumbled upon this place, and what a score! I had their lunch special, which is served with daal, naan, veggies in a lightly spicy sauce, along with the entree of your choice. It is a small space that feels intimate and family owned. They have wine, and super yummy chai. A must, when in the neighbourhood!
author: Tei G.

description:
For me this is the best indian food in SF. The place is tiny bini mini, even if I dont want my hidden gem get explored and packed with hungry patrons, I really want their business get expand, and increase income. They do to go's,  so maybe you should call them and get to go :D
Food: everything in the menu is absolutely delicious. My favorite one is coconut curry lamb. I cant describe its taste without drooling. All the other appetizer and entrees are tasty and portions r generous. If you get in, u should definitely try the garlic naan. 
Service: they r the nicest people on earth. Attentive and professional. 
5+ in everything!
author: Stacy U.

description: This place is awesome! The service is great and the food even better. They are not joking when they say spicy. Be careful ;)
author: Shaena S.

description:
We ordered the chicken tikka masala, saag paneer, raita, side of rice and naan, as well as one mango lassi.
Everything was really good and complemented each other well. I am glad we got the raita and mango lassi because the saag paneer was slightly too spicy for me. I'll have it again though, it's too good!
I want to try more of their vegetarian options!
author: Coralie S.

description: Delicious food! Love the Sag Paneer especially. Great art on the walls. The family who runs the place are really nice & funny. Family friendly, though we can't ever find Indian food that's mild enough for Little tender-mouths, they noticed a meltdown about to happen & brought a little bowl of rice with peas in it and that kept our 2 yo busy. Tiny place, so if you bring a stroller, be ready to lock it up outside.
author: Julie R.

description:
Ok so this was good. We got tandoori chicken kebabs prawns-all good.  

We then ordered entrees. We were asked if we wanted it spicy. We said yes. We are very used to spicy food. The problem? The food was so spicy it was inedible And you couldn't even taste the flavor of the food. Even the butter chicken was loaded with chili powder. Crazy crazy hot. 

Another table said they wanted the food medium but even that was too spicy. 

Maybe chef was having an off day. 

Servers were very sweet and friendly.
author: N B.

description: The flavors are too mild for me.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
This place was amazing and run by a wonderful family. It seems like they sold it or expanded and let someone buy in and run this place as the new staff is all asian and the flavor profiles are off for Indian food. I could always count on this place for giving me properly spicy food and not treating me like a white boy, but the new cooks seem to be using ginger as the primary source of heat. My stomach felt pretty bad afterward. Maybe the owners were on vacation, but based off the latest reviews and fact that nobody else was in the place I'm guessing not.

Really sad to see this place go south because it reminded me of the charm of this neighborhood in face of all the whitewashing yuppification going on.
author: Justin P.

description:
My friend really liked this place so I had high hopes for Saffron Grill. I had more gripes than praise though so let's begin with the praise:

PRAISE:
Their prices are very reasonable for Indian restaurants. The curries were around $9-$11 which is not bad. I've definitely seen places charge like $15 for curries.

The mango lassi was a good flavor (although a bit warm).

The lady recognized regulars and was really friendly.

GRIPES:
Well this place is extremely tiny so I would recommend not bringing more than 4 guests total.

The navaratan korma didn't have enough sauce. Also it was obvious that they used the frozen vegetable medley of green beans, corn, and carrots. Also the korma I like tends to be orange while this was a bright yellow. I think I wouldn't have minded as much except there really wasn't any sauce.

The lamb vindaloo was spicy to the point that my tongue was numb. Others at the table felt the same. I like spicy but then this was maybe a bit too much and caused the rest of my food to not taste like anything.

Also, they charge extra for rice. But who eats curry with nothing?!

We had three dishes that never made its way to the table: two naan and a drink, yet they still charged it to the final bill!
author: Danielle C.

description: Excellent food!  Best Indian food in the city hands down. Wine bottles were very reasonably priced with a wonderful selection. And the server was great!  We will be coming back here a lot.
author: Daniel A.

description: Great meal - we had many dishes - vegetarian and meat - all excellent. And service very friendly- highly recommend.
author: john r.

description: Favorite neighborhood Indian restaurant. Friendly service, solid Indian and clean atmosphere. Mostly I order delivery though, there's no delivery fee if you order via Yelp.
author: Anu O.

description: I love Indian food and I think saffron grill might have been the absolute best place I've been to. I don't write reviews but I felt so compelled to write one. Omg, the curry, masala, na'an, aloo gobi, were all perfection. I will definitely come back as this will be my go to place. Staff was exceptionally nice too. We sort of were sweating due to the natural spices in the food but the staff were so nice and caring. They brought out extra curry for us of a lower spice and brought out yogurt to help us quench the pain. All free of charge. I will definitely come back and get the masala, butter chicken, aloo gobi, saag, and tandoori chicken. Wow, saffron grill is the best !!!!
author: JJ W.

description:
This charming little restaurant is a wonderful refreshing delight in our little neighborhood.

If I were put to the task, I would leave the deathbed of my wife for a taste of the chicken tikka masala. The flavor is a fonder memory in my mind than any she afforded me in her time.
author: Harrison L.

description: I love this place. Food is delicious. Reasonable prices which I feel impacts how frequent we order from here. Owners and staff are very friendly and sweet. Free delivery (this matters!!) and honestly their food is just so good. We LOVE their eggplant dish, their chicken lemon soup is SO GOOD!!! please don't change saffron grill :)
author: Katie D.

description: We order Saffron Grill on Caviar almost weekly, although I've never eaten in the restaurant itself the food is a great go-to, reliable dinner for San Francisco.
author: Jamie K.

description: Great food, the service could use some help they lady was really slow and kind of impatient.
author: Aj M.

description: Family owned restaurant with yummy food. If you like it spicy, they can really turn up the heat if you ask.
author: Brayden S.

description: I had the paneer makhani here which was stellar, and I thought that their garlic naan was also pretty good. I would come back for that dish. Unfortunately, the fish curry we got was not as good. The fish used was salmon, which I think was the wrong type for this dish as it was too strong and ended up tasting off. I overlooked it though, since the paneer was really delicious. They also bring out one complimentary papadom after they take your order, which was nice (although the papadom was slightly soggy -- I prefer the crispier one at Indian Oven).
author: Grace D.

description:
I'm leaving this 5 star review to offset all the doofies who left 1 star b/c they couldn't figure out rice is optionally ordered.  Some funny reviews where it seems the lack of rice shattered their world!  San Francisco first world problems!  Learn how to order food, noobs.

The food is really good too!
author: Bike R.

description: This place is so tasty. The garlic naan is the BOMB and I usually go for the chicken coconut curry. I've also had the tikki masala and it's been really really good. Great price and right around the corner from my place. Good neighborhood spot!
author: Kristina B.

description: The folks that work here are really nice, and food is great to match. We are regular customers and swear by their tikka masala and paneer makhani. Really cozy atmosphere - it feels like you're dining in someone's home at the foot of the Himalayas.
author: Narek A.

description:
Delicious fragrant food and friendly staff. 
Gets noisy at times, so don't expect soft conversations. 
Will go again though!
author: Stewart L.

description:
This is our go to place for Indian food - The food is more "homely" vs. whas served in most indian restaurants - Less cream, Less Oil and more fresh (or so I think). 

Our favorites are - Yellow Daal, Palak paneer and vegetable biryani. Definately a solid choice for folks.

I have never been to the restaurant (always get delivery) so cant speak much about service/ambiance/etc. But food quality is good.
author: Amit D.

description: Very good spices in the chicken Marsala. The naan , yummy, the rice cold . Small little intimate place .
author: goldiebx c.

description: Good food & prices w/ vegetarian options. We arrived early for dinner and got there in the nick of time--once the take-out orders started rolling in, sit-down customers seemed to get badly neglected. If you're blood-sugar crashing at the peak of the dinner rush, try another place. If you're there right when they open for dinner or can chat w/ friends and don't mind waiting, try it!
author: E. R.

description: Just came back home from a wonderful feast at Saffron Grill. Crispy toasted Naan and pappadam and veggie Samosas that were much more flavorful than I had expected. But my Indian neighbor recommended this place and told me the spices are spot on, and of course they are. Next I had the Lamb Biryani a flavorful treat to the senses- tho the fellow birthday diners across from me ordered the chicken tandoori which I plan on having next visit. Even the Mango Lassi with its two ice cubes, just enough to keep it the right temperature had a delightful tang of mango.  I look forward to my next visit- probably next week^.^ *Also as a small note to @Paul J - they are from Nepal at the northern most edge of India so not "Taken over by Asians"*.  Until we eat again,D.
author: David F.

description: I typically enjoy their food, and especially their Tika Massala. I ordered my meal for delivery around 6:45 this evening. Food didn't show up until 8:30 (even though it was quoted to take 45 min). I only live half a mile from the restaurant, so it really should not have taken that long to deliver. When the food got to me, it was cold and the chicken was dry. Very disappointed.
author: Sallye B.

description:
I have no clue how this place got the rating it has. It may even qualify to serve the worst Indian food one can find in the entire Bay Area.
They have this one basic under-cooked "Makhni" gravy that they use to make almost all dishes except lentils.

You can order Chicken Tikka Masala, or Paneer Makhni, or Malai Kofta or anything else with gravy - they ALL taste the same!

And this Makhni gravy is not cooked well at all - you can almost taste the raw tomatoes! All the above dishes have very different gravies if you understand Indian cuisine - it is downright criminal to use one standard gravy for them all ! Alright - maybe you want to save time - but at least make the standard gravy right !

This is far FAR away from good Indian food - please don't eat here. Even the ambiance, just like that food, is bland. But if real Indian food is too spicy for you, you might find this place worth 4 stars because it has no spice at all.
author: Manee S.

description:
I went to this place with friends for dinner one night before drinks and desserts, and it was great! 

We were seated quickly and given recommendations based on our tastes, and spice preferences ;) The staff was friendly and quick. The place was a bit small, which looks like it can get tricky to get a seat if you don't time your arrival just right. But at least it's easy to get to by transit and there's other places nearby you can check out while you wait.

3 of us shared the chicken tikka masala, sag paneer (based on recommendations on Yelp), and a lamb dish (I think it was sag lamb, but I can't quite remember). Also added onion naan and garlic naan. The food was all very good, but I particularly liked the chicken tikka masala and the garlic naan. 

Overall, good place, albeit perhaps a bit pricey for Indian food I think, and the food doesn't come with rice or naan automatically like other reviewers mentioned. But I think I would come back again if I was in the area :)
author: Bianca C.

description: The chicken tikka masala was very sweet. It's not inedible, but it's not what I want from an Indian restaurant.
author: Hamza H.

description: We were excited to try this restaurant due to all of the great reviews and convenient location. However we found the food to be extremely sweet and overpowered by either sugar or honey. We love Indian food for it's spice and savory nature, but this almost tasted like desert. We ordered the tikka masala, sag paner and lamb korma. Very Disappointing and we will not order again.
author: Simone B.

description:
Saffron Grill offers intimate and cozy dining opportunities with its limited seating capacity. The wait list didn't seem to dissuade any parties from dining here, mine included. For a Sunday evening, my wait of 12-15 minutes wasn't bad.

The flavors of their dishes were intense and rich, definitely the spiciest of other Indian restaurants that I've frequented in the neighborhood (I ordered the channa masala, "medium"). The portions were small, typical of the other Indian restaurants around Lower Haight, and the taste was certainly memorable. The service was fine, but our waitress kept apologizing for her "OCD tendencies" and moved around our plates, table, and dishes a lot--causing me a bit of diner's distress.

This place was a-okay, but I'll probably stick to scoping out other spots in these parts.
author: Angel V.

description: The service and food is amazing. I've been here a handful of times (at least 10) and everything on the menu is delicious. My favorite is the salmon tandoori. It's a big portion and great to share with the table. The chicken korma is also very delicious (not too sweet) and the roti is a must. The staff is always friendly and attentive providing excellent customer service. It can get busy at night but it's worth the wait!
author: Lidia L.

description:
I ordered the chicken Tiki Masala, Chicken Tiki kabob,
Vegi Biryani, and Vegi Samosas. Service was ok, I ordered to go, the waitress seemed very pushy on items I wanted to order. While I was trying to make up my mind between two dishes she was trying to tell me to order a different item. I don't like places that try to tell you what to eat. Other than that spices were delicious and the food was not heavy on grease. 

Tiki Masala was very good. Chicken was tender and had authentic taste. Only disapointment was it just was not as spicy, I ordered medium spice .  

Chicken Tiki kabob was very good and worth the price. Again chicken had great flavor and was juicy and tender.

Vegi Samosas were great as well crisp outside, but flavorful and soft potatoes on the inside. Worth buying.

Last, is Vegi Biryani, I was not impressed at all. I had better. This lacked flavor and the rice was a little undercooked. I think this is what made my meal 4 stars other than that I would have gave this place 5 stars for its flavor & presentation.

Fyi: this place is small ; tight seeting, probably can only fit 12 people max. Also if you are ordering to go make sure to ask for the sauses that are supposed to come with your order. If I did not ask if my sauces were inside, I would not have the sauces for my samosas or the yogurt that came with my meal.
author: Andrea R.

description:
This is not a very good restaurant.  My wife and I were very excited to go here because we love Indian food and this restaurant is very close to our home.  While the restaurant location is nice and convenient, that is about all it had going for it.
We ended up ordering a Pakora Appetizer along with Chicken Korma and Navratan Korma entrees.  The Pakora ended up being very salty and overcooked.  Both entrees were pretty bland and unappetizing.  None of this food had the spicy kick or flavorful qualities of typical Indian food.  It was very disappointing.
On top of all of this, I ordered a cup of chai to go along with my meal.  It ended up coming out lukewarm.  When I asked the waitress for a hot cop of chai, they simply microwaved it and handed it back tome.  Chai is not very good microwaved.
Overall this restaurant was a huge disappointment and I don't think we will be returning.
author: JD R.

description: Def not greasy, but missing some of the thick, hearty, spicy, rich flavor you get at places like Pakwan. I wanted that, minus the grease factor. Denied. My arteries thanked me, but my taste buds protested.
author: Gabriela W.

description:
Ordered delivery - it said food would arrive in up to 75 minutes,

It's now 100 minutes later and not only has nothing been delivered (the order was confirmed, I was charged!), but nobody picks up - I've called 4 times and it just rings. Scam. Will never order again.
author: Gina G.

description:
Fabulous. Came into this place on a random recommendation from a stranger in a bar after the place we planned to go was closed. The food was delicious. Chicken Achar was the star, sweet and succulent. Maybe a little less spicy than I would have expected for a 7 on a 1-10 scale (what we requested), but far from bland. The lamb kebab was delicious but just a touch tough and overdone--the only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars.

Small, unpretentious space. No wait, efficient service, just the thing if you're in the mood for solid Indian food without a lot of fuss.
author: Melissa L.

description:
I really liked this place. Pretty decently priced and tasting Indian food. Then they got busy and decided to forget about service entirely. Ordered take out on a Thursday at 630..."that'll be 20 minutes"...go in after 30 and they definitely hadn't started the order. Sat in the corner for another 30 while everyone ignored me and avoided eye contact....got my food after an hour and and they forgot an entree and rice...called back and they insisted everything was right and then hung up the phone. 

Wouldn't waste your time or money here.
author: Griffin G.

description:
WARNING!  The food does not come with rice... You have to order it separately... I don't think anyone in the history of Indian cuisine has had the curry without rice.

Anyways, I ordered delivery and when the food (curry) came, there was no rice. I called them and they said you have to order the rice separately. Never mind that the side order of rice is hidden on the menu and hard to find and I wouldn't dare think the curry I was ordering wouldn't come with rice.

So I had to get in my car and go to the restaurant to pick up rice. When I originally called, the manager said he wouldn't charge me for the rice because of the inconvenience caused. I get there and he charges me $10 for three side orders of rice. 

Now I have to go back and having lost my parking space, I have to spend 20 minutes looking for another parking spot by which time, I get home and my food is obviously all  cold.

It defeated the whole point of ordering out.

Overall, very bad experience.
author: Reza M.

description:
I was looking for a place to eat on Diviz.  I wasn't craving anything specific.  When I saw this in my searches on my Yelp app, I decided to dine here.  Oh Yelp, you never fail me.

It felt like I was entering someone's home when I opened the door.  The dining area is like a converted living space.  Small and intimate.  And I was greeted with such a warm welcome!  We were seated promptly as there were many tables available.

My roommate and I ordered veggie samosas, chicken tikka masala, chicken vindaloo, basmati rice, and garlic naan.  The veggie samosas were really good, especially with the tamarind sauce.  The chicken tikka masala was for me, and I thought that it was small at first.  I was wrong about the third piece of chicken in.  So wrong.. And mind you, I was starving before I entered the restaurant.  I ended up devouring the entire thing, but I really could've stopped at that third piece.  The masala was creamy and savory with a hint of sweetness.   I also really liked the garlic naan.  It was soft with a hint of garlic.

The wait staff were really friendly and attentive.  We were going to get two orders of basmati rice, and the waiter said one would be enough.  I'm glad he suggested it because it really was enough for us, and we had leftovers.

By the end of our meal, all the tables were full, with one party waiting outside.

I definitely want to come back here and try more of their dishes.
author: Vira P.

description: We are so glad to have discovered this amazing restaurant in the city,  it's a cute little place  with about 7 tables clean ambience and absolutely delicious Indian food. We tried Malai kofta and navratan kurma both vegeterian entre's and they were just perfectly cooked.
author: Jinal V.

description:
This is hands down my favorite Indian restaurant. Great tasty authentic Indian food, fast service, and super fun and friendly staff -- kudos to the chick that took care of us last Saturday night! Oh, and aside from the food, their mango lasse is to die for! I can honestly drink at least 2 glasses of that. 

Lastly, this place has successfully converted my bf (who hated Indian food before) into a full-time Indian cuisine lover. Pretty darn awesome don't ya think? ;)
author: Riza D.

description: Very mediocre taste - bland, no salt, mushy koftas.
author: Siddhartha G.

description: Very good and very authentic. I took two Brazilians there, they never had Indian food before. One bite of chicken curry and they want to learn how to cook Indian food. Haha. :)
author: Balu V.

description: The owner is really awesome. Love the service and overall vibe of the place. Will definitely come again for the VIP experience! Excellent across the board.
author: Tony F.

description:
We love how this place feels so much a part of the neighborhood.  The owner always remembers our name (ok we're there a lot, but it's really good).  She super friendly.  They have the best saag paneer.  All other saag's are compared to this one.  

The place is tiny, but that just makes it feel more intimate and special.  Everything we've had here is delicious.  We also do take out quite a bit and it's just as good at home.
author: Jessica A.

description:
Q: Why do I love this place?
A: How many hours do you have?

From the food to the service, Saffron Grill makes eating out feel like eating in. The waitress is the sweetest, funniest person ever and I feel 75% of the reason I go to Saffron is just so I can chat with her. She is hilarious. 

The dips, the naan, the curries, everything is made fresh with great spices and most importantly some good ol fashioned TLC. My personal favorite is the Chicken Tikka Masala - a classic and you just can't go wrong with it. 

When it comes to the naan, do yourself a favor and order the Garlic AND the Plain, both amaze, both worth it. 

Beware: the restaurant and seating is on the smaller side, but they get you in and out in decent time, so don't be alarmed if you have to stand awkwardly in the doorway until there is room for you to take a seat.

Enjoy!
author: Katie K.

description:
Best north Indian food I think I've had. My Indian fiance agrees.

Best service I've had.

The Achar and Gulab Jamun are both uniquely awesome.

Go here.
author: Brook S.

description:
Items I've had at Saffron Grill:
- Mango Lassi
- Pakora
- Samosa's
- Chicken Tikka Masala (Medium)
- Saag Paneer (Medium)
- Raita

Overall
- Everything I had was really good
- The service was excellent
- The Medium is rather spicy, but good
author: Dipesh G.

description:
This place was fantastic as soon as we opened the door.

The smell of rich curry and spices was as comforting as a nice mountain of mashed potato and gravy.

Then, the food!

It was easily the best samosa I have ever eaten. And, I've eaten Indian all over the country.

Our server Ashok was extremely friendly and on-point. You will be proud to recommend this to friends!
author: Joseph D.

description: Hands down the best Indian food I've  had. Korma and tikka are delicious and the staff is great as well. Would highly recommend go out of your way for this place
author: Dante Z.

description: Amazing food..  authentic Indian restaurant serving delicious food. Best Indian restaurant in sF
author: Vaghesh P.

description:
Ordering was easy because all of the Indian dishes I know and love were on the menu. 

Samosa's: Check; yum

Sag Paneer: Check ; right consistency; yum

Chicken Tikka Masala: Check; not too spicy; lots of sauce; yum

Lamb Vindaloo; Check; very spicy (which I knew going in); lots of sauce; yum

Basmati Rice: Check; pretty hard to mess up; yum

The service was great!

Indian food is as always pretty expensive... not exactly sure why.
author: Marc B.

description:
Food was really, really good. Definitely the best Saag Paneer I've ever had...most places it looks like cheese globs floating in creamed spinach. Here, it was lighter, with more texture and distinct flavors. Very good. The Korma was of the same ilk - a light cream sauce with tender, but crisp vegetables.

I'm giving them five stars because of the way they treated my family. We have a 13 month-old daughter and dining out can be a challenge sometimes. We often feel self-conscious and rush through meals to avoid an...incident.

From the moment we came in to Saffron Grill, the hostess was not just personable, but genuinely friendly. She immediately started playing with our daughter and brought her an electric candle to play with. The chef sent out a dish of peas for her to munch on while we waited for dinner. The meal was a dream - our daughter was content, loved the food, and we enjoyed a leisurely meal. A rare treat with a small child.

I actually teared up a little bit writing this review. You don't expect more than tolerance when bringing a messy cry-tornado into a restaurant, so the true hospitality we enjoyed at Saffron Grill made it THE best meal we've had since our daughter was born. We will definitely be back!
author: Alex L.

description: The dishes are incredible and authentic. The staff is also what keeps me coming back. Very nice people, chill atmosphere, amazing food, AND cheap! Doesn't get much better than that!
author: TJ G.

description:
If your sign says open 'til 945 that means you should be seating until 945. Especially when I walk in at 930. At 930 they told me I could only order take out.

Come again? 

And the server was far from pleasant and asked another table if they could reach over and switch off their sign while they were eating. Who the fuck does that? 

Then I order chicken tikka masala and get some other dish that has zero yogurt or cream base and tastes like nothing resembling tikka masala. The chicken tasted like it was boiled in water and had ZERO grilled element to it. 

The mango chutney tasted like it came from a can. 

Awful. Awful. Awful.
author: Mohammad G.

description: I had the prawn coconut curry and basmati rice. What I love about this place is that they'll spice up the curries for you if you want! They are also very friendly and nice. Good neighborhood spot.
author: Riana L.

description: This great little Indian restaurant. Very authentic chicken tikka masala. Loved the Naan. Will definitely return.
author: Bruce L.

description: This place was sooooo amazing. Probably my favorite Indian food in the city but they changed the owners and now the food is really different and I hate to say it but not as good. Used to be a 5 star spot. Now it's just OK.
author: Anand P.

description: Passed by and (not as usuall) decided to try it. A nice neighborhood discovery. Excellent food. Eggplant and Okra specials  were outstandingly good and not oily. The Onion Naan and condiments  were superb as well.
author: Syc R.

description: This is the second time we've eaten at Saffron Grill and the experience as been consistently good! Our selection was a little spicy (especially Chicken Sagqala) but very overall very good. One dish can easily satisfy two people.
author: Florent B.

description: So good! The only thing I must warn is that they will make some of the dishes too spicy. I love spicy but Ill say "medium" and will still be sweating. The kind of spicy that doesn't sit too well. I've learned to say "mild" to be on the safe side.
author: Brianna N.

description:
First this place has online ordering which is great. Second while I waited I ordered a mango lassi and the owner gave it to me for free since he didn't have change for a twenty. He said, "just get it next time".

Mango lassi's are stellar. Then I did the lamb sag, meh, just ok not really creamy or flavorful. Also did the aloo chat it was also meh. Not sure what happened here but neither dishes overwhelmed me. Also I thought the portion was a tad on the small side.

Great service! Cozy place to share a meal with a date for sure.
author: Junebug J.

description: Great place all the dishes were extremely fresh and the naan was super tasty.  Small and cozy place but def a solid spot for indian food.  Price was about 15 per person but we left stuffed.
author: James F.

description:
Scrumptious Indian food. For main dishes you have to go with their signature, the Lamb Archar. Also you can't leave the restaurant without trying the Gulab Jamun. The best I've ever had!

What's also great is there is no wait on a Saturday night.

Only issue is that the service can be a hit or miss. But the food is too good to pass up this restaurant.
author: Sunitha N.

description: Simple, tasty North Indian cuisine at a very good price. No frills here, all about the dishes. Strong in flavor, almost everything under $15, and fair service. Excellent value.
author: Alexander M.

description: Excellent food. Recommend the chicken tikka masala. Inexpensive ($5-6 per glass) wine that they fill up nicely. Quick service. Excellent friendly wait staff. Family owned restaurant. My new favorite local Indian restaurant.
author: Will H.

description: Delivery arrived... began eating.. Crunch crunch... found pieces of broken glass in my lamb achar. $20 spent for dinner I couldn't eat. Wtf! NEVER again. Enough said.
author: Alex R.

description: I dropped by to order to-go chai this past weekend, but they didn't have any to-go cups. Instead, they gave me unlimited refills, so I drank four cups. Very worth it :) This was late at night too, when most restaurants are cranky because they're about to close. I'll be back! Tonight actually!
author: David T.

description: If you're ever cold on a winters evening, hit up this place cause the food is spicy and the small space is an INFERNO. Awesome food, awesome atmosphere and awesome wait staff. I mostly eat vegetarian, and although thats a pretty easy thing to support in indian food, their veg dishes are particularly spectacular. 10/10!
author: Robbie S.

description: I had food delivered from Saffron Grill twice. The food was great. The delivery does take close to an hour.
author: Viswa V.

description: I absolutely LOVE the food here. Such delicious, rich flavors and friendly service.
author: Will D.

description:
Not sure what's happened here since the fire  but man oh man..it's like a different place. New chef maybe? Dry (probably reheated) tandoor? Decent lamb dish, but 4 chunks for $15? The worst biryani I think I've ever had - wrong from top to bottom. And all that jazz, a meal for two, for $70? 3x Shalimar prices, for 1/3rd the quality? Yikes. 

That said, 5 stars for the owner. She's the best!!!!! But not enough to overcome the bad, overpriced food :$(
author: Steve H.

description: Great place to take out food from. Delicious tasting food cooked more in a Nepali style. Definitely convenient to take out form. It's cramped inside and doesn't have the most awesome ambience but the food flavor profile is very solid
author: Ron M.

description:
FOOD: Their butter chicken is tasty. So is the malai kofta. I wasn't terribly impressed with the lamb coconut curry. I only ever get mild, but my friend tells me the spicy is very spicy. I'm a big fan of their samosas too and the garlic naan. Portions are a bit small but still enough for me.

ENVIRONMENT: A tiny restaurant; doesn't look like much on the outside. Best to come with two to four people. I've never had much of a wait but I've seen one form after I've gotten there. Casual. Great for a weeknight dinner or something easy on the weekend. Looks like they do a lot of take out orders as well.

SERVICE: Everyone at this restaurant is so friendly, I love it. They talk to you like they see you all the time and are very accommodating.
author: Kailyn G.

description: We had take out from this restaurant and it heavily disappointed me. Before their fire about two years ago, their take out was one of the best in the area. The rice that we got was dry, so were the shrimp. The samosas were a little undercooked and hard to chew. Because of this, I can't simply go back to them again and it's a shame because I was really looking forward to my meal.
author: Carolina S.

description:
small intimate place with great food! 
the servers were helpful and got my friend some milk coz he ate a green chili.
author: Parikshit T.

description: We tried to order off grubhub.  They failed to send the order to the resturaunt.  The resturaunt was very nice about it.  So we called back later and placed an order for pick-up.  The food was delicious, we will call them directly next time.
author: Ryan R.

description:
Ordered delivery to my hotel after reading the rave reviews.  Food arrived promptly, in 20 minutes instead of the indicated 45.  But the food was TERRIBLE.  This is the first time Yelp has been so far off the mark.  Part of me wants to think San Franciscans just don't know good Indian.  But there are plenty of poorly reviewed Indian places too, so this place must be doing *something* to warrant the four star reviews??

My family is from North India, I've spent 8 years in Delhi and 16 in the UK, so I know good Indian food. This was not it.  In fact this was probably one of the worst Indian takeouts I've ever had in any country.  I even stuck with the popular dishes: chicken tikka masala, saag paneer, basmati rice and garlic naan.  I have a bottomless appetite when it comes to Indian food but tonight I had to stop eating, un-full simply because I was so put off.  

Extremely bland, flavourless and the curries were just wrong.  The saag paneer didnt appear to be made from spinach -- it wasnt creamy the way spinach gets when you cook it down, rather it looked / tasted like parsley.  The CTM was terrible.  The colour was all wrong (a pale orange instead of red), no spice and no tanginess to it.  I couldnt taste any garam masala or really much of anything.  The naan was dry, thick and paper like, which sure after a 10 minute bike ride, I dont expect it to be pristine but naan holds up longer than that.  Also garlic? I could go on a kissing spree right now and no one would detect a thing.  Worst of all, the food had no aroma.  Anyone who knows good Indian knows it fills the air with a rich strong fragrance that spurs on the appetite needed! 

Dunno if the delivery is drastically different from the eat in experience but I strongly suggest you avoid.
author: Tash P.

description:
Such a disappointment. Maybe cuz i ordered right before close- i had a to go order of butter chicken exrra sipcy.

I was so excited to get home and eat this deliciousness. When i got home, i opened the container and thought- thats odd. Thats not the usual creamy orangey hued smooth creamy butter chicken sauce. Instead it was a chuncky reddish tomatoe sauce. Not only was the texture different- the flavors were bland and even a little sweet- nothing spicy about it. Even my very white cant eat spicy at all friend could handle with ease the degree of spice. 

I had to add my own chili powders to make it slightly more flavorful. 

Not sure if they put the lid on the wrong order or if thats their version of butter chicken ... Sad sad monkey. Craving unmet.
author: Nyra T.

description:
After reading all of the great reviews for this place, I was excited to check it out.  We got a variety of dishes for takeout:

-Chicklen Tikka Masala
-Lamb Vindaloo
-Seekh Kebab
-Malai Koftas
-Samosas
-Naan
-Roti

The food was not great.  It was extremely sweet without much other flavor.  I am guessing this is Bengali food, but I was under the impression it was supposed to be Punjabi.  The only dish that had any semblance of spice was the vindaloo and it was an after-burn.  They also forgot to include chutney for our samosas and kebabs.  To top it all off, it wasn't cheap and the portions were small.  I'll stick to my neighborhood joint.
author: Ravi R.

description:
Solid 4 stars.  The food was really delicious and traditional Indian food.  When you see the fennel seeds by the front door, that's how you know.  Everything was seasoned perfectly and not overly salty.  The sauces were well emulsified.  The Crispy Roti was fantastic. Our lamb was delicious and tender.

The restaurant only seats a handful, but there's enough room between each table.  It's just the right level of ambiance around sunset.  I'd come here again and again and again.  It's not super expensive either, just under 30 bucks for 2 people including tip. 

The wait staff were very friendly and didn't mind pointing out things we should try.
author: Stanley L.

description:
Gosh I just love the hostess/waitress/owner lady at this place. She is the awesomest!

I just order the popular dishes here and have not been disappointed. 

As far as the spice level is concerned, listen to the lady when she tells you medium will make you sweat. One time I ordered medium thinking oh I'm so badass I can handle it. Yeah...NOPE. I probably drank a gallon of water with that meal.

Somewhat hilariously, the lady remembered the next time I came here and was like "so, you still want medium?"
author: Katherine Y.

description:
Saffron Grill is an example of the kind of place that Yelp really comes through for...because honestly, I probably never would have made it into this restaurant without the Yelp raves, and now that I have, my boyfriend and I are hooked. How hooked are we? We have been there 4 times in 2014 alone and January isn't even over yet.

Saffron Grill is the kind of restaurant that I knew almost immediately would be good. You walk in, and it's busy and cozy....but not the kind of busy that feels frantic or claustrophobic...the kind of busy that feels like other people know what's up and are choosing to wait there because it's good. The staff is super attentive - which is important when the place is busy. They lock eyes immediately as you walk in, and communicate how long the wait is and what you should do. This detail makes all the difference in the world, and on our first visit (a Friday at the prime dinner hour of 7 PM), this was a good, early indicator that it would be a pleasant experience. 

The wait has never been more than 10 minutes - and the food is well worth it! Some of the freshest, most delicious, flavorful Indian I have ever had. It truly tastes like home cooking...if your home was in North India, I suppose :) We have had multiple lamb and chicken dishes, and been pleased with them all. My boyfriend also loves their Mango Lassies. 

We will continue to go back, and sooner than later because even typing this review made me long for some Vindaloo and Naan!
author: Serena Q.

description: This is what I call "clean" Indian food. It's healthy and delicious, not too buttery/creamy, well-priced, nice space, super nice service, $18 bottle of malbec. Navratan korma was my favorite here. I'd go back!
author: Andrew K.

description:
Remember this day: January 12, 2014. Today was the day that I had the best Indian food from a restaurant in. my. life! Wow! Where do I begin? My friend wanted to go out for dinner and when she mentioned Indian food, I was a little disappointed because being Indian, I am privileged to have the best cooks right at home. And now that I am far from home, it's nice to try Indian food, but then I just feel disappointed, and with heart burn. But this place was different. 

I enter and it's a nice small, quaint restaurant with great art work and ambiance. We sit down and I get a little nervous because I don't see anyone Indian, but then I have to remind myself that all the Indians in the Bay Area are mostly in the Silicon Valley. We get seated and they serve me my favorite beer, Taj Mahal.
