Our server (I think she is part of the family business) asks how spicy we want our food and my friend said "medium" and I didn't feel like ordering a separate "spicy" dish so I just went with medium. She asked again, "Are you sure?" Girrrrrrrrl please, I'm Indian. 

Woah. WOAH. Holy woah! We ordered the sag paneer, chicken tikka masala, and garlic naan. They also served us spicy papad with the green chutney. It was the best Indian meal I have ever enjoyed at a restaurant. I think I will be having dreams about this restaurant. I wanted to hug the owner (and touch the owner's feet - for all my Indian homiez). I even wanted to cry tears of joy and tears of spiciness! I can't wait for my mom to try this place! Hell, I can't wait for every Indian I know (all three of them) to try this place! It took a long time to get the food, but it was worth the wait. 

The food is spicy and they could care less if you are Indian or if you are a cute little southern girl, they will bring it! They serve room temperature water which I love, but this time, I was craving ice. The food wasn't overly oily and overly "masala-y". I don't know why some Indian restaurants pour oil into their food and think that's okay. OR, they put every Indian spice that exists all into one dish and it's like a cardamom explosion in my mouth. 

We didn't have any of the desserts but I think all of their heart and soul goes into their regular food. It would be nice for them to have homemade desserts too but that is very laborious. I was a little disappointed because they didn't have Bhindi (okra) but it's because their ingredients are all fresh and sometimes it's difficult to get fresh okra. She also told me that if I ever have their bhindi that I won't ever enjoy it anywhere else. She's right. Except that now applies for every Indian dish I order from now on. This place ranks up there next to my momma's cooking and my grandmomma's cooking! (They are a North Indian restaurant so no idli or dosa). 

SO DELICIOUS! MmMmMmm! And they have supari (it's like a post dinner minty kind of thing) :) 

PS... My mouth is still on fire.
author: Leena B.

description:
There is pretty much nothing I would change about this place (other than maybe having a couple delicious IPAs on tap (or even in bottles?) to go with my Lamb Achar pleeeeease???) 

The food is incredible, you know that feeling you get after eating cheap, greasy north Indian food (like your stomach  is saying WTF?), that doesn't happen here because the ingredients are quality and the curries just taste homemade, spicy yet subtle. This is the closest thing I've found to my favorite curry house when I lived in the UK (which has substantially better Indian food than the US). The lamb and chicken achar are my favorites. 

Then to add to that is RITA!  Rita is one of the coolest and best owner/servers I've ever encountered - the minute you walk in the door it feels like you're at your friends/family's restaurant - she's made every visit memorable and awesome and I leave with a smile on my face every time.
author: Ben B.

description: I've been to saffron 3 times, this time it looks like the management has changed. But the food is still great I ordered a Channa masala with garlic naan and the it was delicious. Also the waitresses are really nice...loved my experience and will definitely be going back whenever I'm in SF :)
author: Grisha K.

description:
The food was mostly bland, lacking the signature spice and vibrancy that makes Indian food so enjoyable. The chicken tika masala was boring, and the samosas were dry.

Atmosphere was also subpar. The place was empty and really quiet on a Saturday, no music and very close quarters. Will not be going again.
author: John M.

description:
Wow, really? This was terrible. Bland bland bland. I'm not a snob either, I'll eat any Indian food. But a hole in the wall joint for half the price is better than this. The sauces were watery, the chicken was hard rubber, the saag paneer definitely didn't taste like the saag paneer I remember. 

Avoid this place and save your money. You're better off hitting a spot on Polk or getting a Tasty Bite.
author: Boris Y.

description:
Are you kidding me with these 4 star reviews ?! Reviews for ethnic food of all types is totally out of whack here in san francisco. 
The chicken tikka masala was not flavorful. Chicken was chewy. Don't get me started on the sad excuse they serve for aloo chaat.
Ordered on the phone. Went there at the time they gave and had to wait an additional 25 minutes. Would have overlooked this if the food was halfway decent. 

Still on the quest to find authentic tasting Indian food in the city without trekking all the way to the South Bay.
author: Vin A.

description:
Not bad.

Kind of overpriced in my opinion for the portions, but really good food.  I like the ambiance / decor.  It's neighborhoody, and not over-done.  It's a tiny tiny place, and some people were eating there alone.  I would've probably felt comfortable doing that there.  I also probably wouldn't recommend taking someone out on a first date here.  Take-out seemed to be a popular option, and it made sense.

Service was WEIRD.  There was a man and a woman working, and there seemed to be confusion between them.  We were given someone else's check soon after we sat down, which was just odd because the table next to us had clearly just finished, and we hadn't yet ordered.  Honest mistake, but the place wasn't crowded, so I didn't think it was a hard thing to mix up?  I think it was just weird because they didn't apologize... just took the check away and bickered with each other quietly.  The waitress was really quiet, but made good recommendations on food.

The vegetarian dishes were good!  I forget what I ordered, but it was something that a bunch of other people had ordered on yelp.  It's also what the waitress had recommended.  One thing I thought was forgettable was the Garlic Naan.  Entrees were definitely good, though.

If I'm in the area, I wouldn't mind coming back, but I'd probably go for take-out!  Food was still good the next day.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Really enjoyed the food here. Everything was flavorful and delicious. One of the best Indian restaurants I've been been to in SF!
author: J P.

description:
It wasn't until this place, did I truly enjoy chicken and Indian food. Must have:

complimentary thing crisp bread (don't know what it's called but the sauces....:::drool:::)
-somosa
-garlic naan

-Anything chicken - seriously, I never used to eat chicken in any meal and this stuff is so damn tender

-Anything lamb - delicious

-Saag paneer - FYI, this was the only dish I used to order at an indian restaurant.  Thanks to the B-F, I have now tried many other items.  I let him order, but this is amazing too. 

Also - the girl, the owner's daughter??? SHE IS HILARIOUS and so welcoming.  The BOMB if we ever still used that term this day in age.  

Best in the BAY!
author: Candice H.

description: Bomb Indian food. Second time I ordered delivery and it was better than the first! Timely, friendly and the food is delicious...not greasy and tasty, full of flavor. Will continue ordering from them!
author: Vanessa R.

description: Garlic naan and veggie samosas were good, buuuuut i feel like those items are also passable foods when frozen or packaged from trader joes. Raita was bland, as was the butter chicken. Not my favorite, not very much chicken in this dish. Naansense!
author: Adele A.

description: Probably the best indian we've had- so FRESH and LIGHT (hardly any oil in the dishes). Intimate and quiet, we liked the atmosphere. We ordered the spinach gobi and a classic lamb curry, along with rice and delicious nan. Very friendly staff. We are definitely coming back!
author: Maya M.

description:
I live a few blocks away and don't cook much, so have eaten from just about all of the reasonably priced Indian establishments in the area. This one is the best. It's no-nonesense and fairly priced food that just tastes great, and it doesn't leave you with as much of that heavy and sluggish feeling as a lot of cheap Indian food does. 

One warning: I have a pretty high tolerance for spicy, but this food is hot, so adjust the way you order accordingly ("mild" = "medium" at many other restaurants).
author: Alex F.

description: Can't think of an indian dinner that ive had that i could say competed with this. World class food and excellent customer service. They were very busy when we walked in, but our food still came quickly and was absolutely delicious! The waitress was adorable and very friendly. I higly recommend this restaurant.
author: Ron L.

description: Fast delivery, good cuts of meat. The food was not authentic Indian and did not match up to quality Indian food that I have had in the past.
author: Michelle K.

description:
great spot to grab food if you're seeing something at the Independent two blocks away.  As others have said the food is affordably priced, authentic, and delicious.  But it can also get busy so make sure to leave time so you're not rushing to your show.  We called ahead for a reservation and it helped.

Lamb/chicken vindaloo and garlic naan were favorites, and the veggie menu is very strong.
author: Alex C.

description: First off, let me just say - I had a great time here! It's a small venue, definitely better for parties of four or less. I went with my family just before the dinner rush arrived though and our big group was seated in no time. It's served family style and don't let your eyes deceive you - the dishes may appear small but they're really filling. Everything was traditional and done really well, I loved it. It also looked like they were displaying local art so that's neat. Anyways, my family and I left full and happy and the owner/manager was really nice.
author: Jacqueline B.

description: We have eaten here and ordered delivery many times. Overall it's a great local Indian restaurant at moderate prices. Service is very friendly. I recommend the baigan bartha and korma dishes. Beware- if you order your food spicy it is truly SPICY.
author: J L.

description:
This is the best Indian I've eaten since living in Delhi for a month.  What's more, they don't put a pretentious price premium on classic comfort food dishes like a lot of other SF Indian joints (I'm looking at you, Dosa!)

These guys are still getting back on their feet after a structure fire, so our order was a bit mixed up, and took longer than it should have, but the wine was flowing, and when we got our entrees they were so good we didn't even care.  

Tip: They might try to talk you out of ordering "spicy," but if you're used to non-Americanized Indian/Asian cuisine go for it!  It would be considered pretty mild in India.
author: James G.

description:
This is a small place but the food is excellent (and the portion sizes are just right).  And when they say spicy they really mean it! 

I had the chicken vindaloo and my girlfriend had the lamb sag. Both were excellent. The naan was also very good (we had the plain naan and the onion naan).

Definitely going back to this place again.
author: Eggert B.

description: Best Indian food I've ever had coupled with the best service. Everything made fresh with the finest ingredients and you can certainly taste it! First time visiting this place (on a whim) and it was a little small but it vastly exceeded my expectations. Will make it a point to come back here when I visit the city. Highly recommend!!!
author: Matt B.

description: Excellent food and atmosphere! Server was very attentive and absolutely the funniest person I've ever met. We had the Saag Paneer, Chicken Tikka Masala and the house lamb, all medium heat. I live in Louisiana and pretty accustomed to spicy food and after eating for five minutes I was glistening (which was perfect for me ) Would highly recommend this restaurant to any of my friends.
author: Charles F.

description: This place used to be great. Now service is terrible. Food served room temperature. Waited an hour for food, which is probably why it was cold. Likely not coming back to this establishment
author: Keith M.

description:
This place is a few blocks from my house, but I have no clue where it's at exactly (this review is based off a delivery order).  I'm sure I've been by it quite a few time though, but even by looking at signage in the pictures posted here I don't recognize the place.

Anywho, me & my roommates, got delivery from here and I thought it was pretty good.  When it comes to Indian food I'm pretty game for anything so I let one of the roomies handle the order.  We ordered a lentil dish, a lamb dish, and two chicken curries (one of which I know was tikka masala).

I thought everything was good, but nothing really stood out.  I wouldn't say the food is bland, but when I eat Indian food I expect a LOT flavor & spice, and I just didn't  get that from anything at Saffron Grill.  The lentil dish in particular was lacking, and all though I thought the two chicken dishes were good I could hardly tell the difference between the tikka masala and the other one we ordered (I honestly don't remember which dish it was).  Probably my favorite curry we ordered was the lamb (I'm pretty sure it was the vindaloo).  The meat was tender and the spices seemed a LITTLE more distinct than the chicken dishes.

Since Saffron Grill is close to my house I would probably get food from there again (the prices are adequate as well).  However, if I was with a group of people who really wanted to get Indian food, and didn't mind venturing out to get it, I would probably choose someplace else.
author: George A.

description:
Sir Nicholas and I recently enjoyed dinner at this tiny, hole-in-the-wall-ish restaurant. The ambiance feels like you might be dining in a friend's family home, and the quality of the food also has that same homemade goodness to it. The service is overwhelmingly friendly and when they say things will be spicy rest assured they are very much so telling you the truth.

We started with the Assorted Appetizer which included samosas (puff pastries filled with potatoes sweat peas, herbs and spices and vegetable pakora (mixed vegetable fritters coated with garbanzo beans batter) and both were great. My main dish however stole the show. I had an order of Chicken Vindaloo that was beautifully spicy, burning my mouth in a delightful way and causing me to break out in a little bit of sweat.

They have good naan as well, and a couple of particularly interesting versions including one filled with lamb and another filled with nuts, raisins, and cherries. We tried both at our table and the second one was almost like eating a dessert. Overall Saffron Grill was quite a nice option for an affordable Indian dinner and I would easily go back again.
author: Tiffany N.

description: Part of what wasn't great is we ordered two things that were basically the same but not totally obvious when we ordered it. We got chicken curry, lamb curry, saag paneer, chana masala and naan. Everything was fine but I probably will not go back. Pretty mediocre, the food needed salt and the curry's were sweeter and more tomatoy than I prefer
author: Mario T.

description:
4 stars for a place that has the blandest sauces, worst service and hard naan missing patches?! Yelp, this time you have really let me down.

I wish I took pictures. But my kabul naan had gaps missing. Like 1/8 of the bottom part was gone. It was also hard as a rock. It was the blandest paneer makhani I had in my life. Absolutely nothing defined it and tasted like a microwaved paste straight out of a can. Worst Indian food I have ever had. And I love my Paneer so I make it at home.

Service was silly: I asked for a mango lassi twice and never got it. Like twice and was told that its coming by the same guy. The woman working there was helpful but I expect what I order to come through and not getting to the bill. Yup and of course it appeared on the bill. Take that off!

What I liked? It wasn't too expensive: $40 for two, and I like the reasonably priced glass of wine for $6.

That area of Divis lacks Indian food but next time I'm Uber'ing to Lower Haight is what I'm gonna do.
author: Dmitriy S.

description:
The only Indian food spot in the area. They do it right. Samosas are amazing. Naan is fresh baked all the time. The spices are wonderful.

I've never dined in, as I've had the luxury of walking a few blocks to get here. The ambiance inside is tiny. Very intimate. I would take the right person or people here for a mellow dinner.

The prices are a bit high, but the food is great quality.

If the prices were lower I'd go 5 stars in a heartbeat.
author: Ross H.

description: This is my new favorite place in the city! Everything we ordered was absolutely amazing. The owner of the restaurant really made our experience golden though - she was so sweet and accommodating, like we were eating in her home. She even held my seven month old for a while & showed her the kitchen! I wish we lived closer so that we could visit saffron all the time.
author: Kristen H.

description:
The food here used to be decent.  I have been there at least 10 times and each time it seems to get worse.

My most recent experience will be my last.  We called in an order for CTM, Yellow Daal, Chicken Soup, Garlic Naan and Raita.  The soup and raita were inedible, and the rest of the food was bland and barely edible.  

When we called to inform Saffron Grill of the quality problem, we spoke to someone named 'AJ'.  He was very rude and condescending.  He was certainly not interested in the feedback, nor in remedying the problem.

They clearly do not care about their customers, so how can you trust them to serve you quality food?  If they are this bad with their customer service, what do you think they are doing to your food?  

Save your money and go elsewhere.  This is San Francisco. There are so many better options.
author: Greg T.

description: Yes! Delicious Indian food in my neighborhood. Place is very cute, food is delicious (SPICY!) and service is great. Will definitely come back.
author: Natasha F.

description: The best Indian delivery we've had in SF. I'm not sure how authentic the food is, but everything we've tried (mostly chicken and veggie dishes, as well as biryani) has been great and also different from our other options. The main difference: most other Indian places we've tried make everything so rich and heavy - swimming in cream and oil. The food here is much lighter, and a bit less indulgent and flavorful, but perfect for a weeknight dinner. We live nearby, and delivery (via Grubhub) has always been relatively quick and without issues.
author: Caitlin J.

description: Took 2 hours for delivery, while being half a mile away. Also they only provide the soup base with three pieces of chicken in the butter chicken. No rice or Nann provided. Just a warning to other customers. A pint of sauce for 12 bucks with anything else. We had guests over and this was so embarrassing!
author: Philip A.

description: I am so surprised that I have not reviewed my favorite Indian spot in SF yet. I actually stumbled upon them when my friend and I were hungry and were looking for a place to eat before we went to Candy Bar which is on the opposite side of the street. Although the inside is small it reminds me of a little home and has that home-y atmosphere. I also liked that the waitress was very hospitable and let us take our time in ordering. We ordered the tikka masala, naan, and rice and although it came in what looked to be three little bowls, it was enough to feed three people. I also like that it was right in the middle of the spice- o-meter, it wasn't too spicy for me as a spice wimp and it wasn't too bland either. It had really good flavors and was right on point in terms of price.
author: Desiree C.

description:
EDIT: I just read other 1 star reviews and it has made other people sick too!!

Spoiler: it made my roommate sick.
 
I'm giving 1 star because at least the staff was nice (but also you can't give any lower than 1 star) My channa masala was so dry it tasted like it had been re-heated and all the moisture was gone (also very bland). The basmati was not light and moist, it was heavy and dry and clumpy. I had to break it up with the fork and sip water every other bite to keep it palatable. (Also, they had very few vegetarian options that were also vegan) My roommate got a mango lassi, and the chicken tikka masala, he said it also tasted like it had been reheated. We left and decided to never go back. This is not the worst part though. My roommate was SICK ALL NIGHT long. Very sick. Indian food is my favorite, and I eat it all the time, and I wanted to like this place because we live nearby, but it was really terrible, and my roommate is still sipping gatorade. I honestly don't understand how this place has good reviews.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: I have tried this restaurant before and after the fire.  I have to say, it still remains the most bland Indian food I have ever tasted!
author: Amber B.

description: I ordered a delivery. It got a great Garlic Nan bread!
author: Acacia D.

description: There are two kinds of Indian food .... Home cooked or overpriced fancy restaurant cuisine. This is most definitely home cooked and really darn good. What a treat to find this place in a neighborhood full of too groovy overpriced places with long lines. It is small and cozy, not fancy, and clearly does a booming take out business. The food is a bargain, it tastes great, and we are still eating the leftovers two days later. We highly recommend trying saffron grill next time you are near Divisedaro  and Fulton.
author: Craig A.

description: Oh dear. . . we were here several years ago for dinner and it was excellent.  I don't know if there has been a change of ownership or what, but we dined there yesterday evening and the fare qualified as barely mediocre.  Also, this is a very small place, which is fine, but yesterday evening, the staff in the kitchen were banging large pots and pans very loudly, probably while washing them, and it created such an ongoing din, we could hardly hear each other talk, even though we were the only customers there.  The staff is friendly and service is good enough, but we were sorely disappointed by what has happened with the actual food in this place, and we won't be back.  : (
author: Heather T.

description:
Can you say delicious and flavorful food?
Can you say fastest phone order and pick up service ever?
Can you say customer service with a smile?

Saffron offers all of this. 

Our business is nearby and we pick up to go orders quite
frequently.   The staff/owner knows "our usuals".  When they
say it will be ready in five minutes, they mean it. 
(Elena is one of our favorite persons there.)

The salads are always fresh and seasoned perfectly
and I'm a big fan of their Falafels.  My co-worker most 
recently enjoyed the lamb kebabs.
author: H D.

description: Had dinner here tonight and it was such a good time. We all ordered the Salmon special and devoured it. We also had the Garlic Nan and extra vege's. Everything was delicious. Definitely coming back.
author: Joanne F.

description: What a great place! Everything was tasty and cooked perfectly!  You can taste how fresh the ingredients are.  The food was so good that I even forgot to take pictures!  Would definitely go back!!
author: Sabrina H.

description:
What a gem of a place!!!!
We walked here on a Friday night close to 8pm after Nopalito told us the wait was an hour plus...We walked right in and were seated instantly--love that!!  :)
The restaurant is cozy and only has a few tables...
Our server, RITA, was incredibly helpful, friendly and FUNNY!!!! 
Food = super YUMMY goodness...be clear about how much spice you can handle as they can deliver SPICY--YAY!! :)
Looking forward to my next visit...
author: Danae R.

description:
Came here for a quick bite the other night. Opened the door of what looked like a house to enter a cute little restaurant smelling of yummy curry and spices. I will say it was like a sauna in there! The place is really small without many windows so I can see how it gets so hot. It wasn't uncomfortably hot but between the heat and the spicy food I left the restaurant gleaming a little. The service was fantastic! Our server was sooo cute and friendly! I didn't catch her name but she definitely made the experience with her sense of humor and recommendations.
 We came right  from a sushi restaurant where we didn't get full so we didn't order much at Saffron. For my two friends and I we shared the garlic naan and chicken tikki masala. I was sold when our waiter asked HOW SPICY I wanted my masala. Yaassss. I love that question at a restaurant. We got the medium spicy which was perfect! Just enough to give it that kick! The masala was quite tasty and not as creamy as other masalas I've had. I really enjoyed it. I would recommend getting three dishes for three people but because we weren't very  hungry this did the trick. The garlic naan was perfect! It's sectioned off into 4 pieces making it really easy to share amongst the table.

I would definitely come back here, especially on a day when I'm super hungry so I can feast on multiple dishes. Also if you're dying for dessert afterward there's a Bi-rite market/creamery right down the street! Enjoy!
author: Jessica B.

description: Edible is the best compliment I can provide. Fiancée and I are very unimpressed. Ordered the chicken tikka masala and lamb vindaloo for delivery. Food took 1.5 hours to get to us first of all. Both dishes were awful. Flavorless and missing most of the tasty ingredients that make both dishes great. Seems pretty hard to screw up these, especially since mediocre Indian restaurants can still pull at least chicken tikka masala off. Lastly, the naan was like eating rubber. Will not be going to this place or order from it again.
author: Anthony D.

description: I wanted to like this place. I really did. However, being Indian, I have high expectations from any Indian. In authentic Indian food terms, spicy means an the right blend of lots of different spices. Spices other than just red chilly powder. This is the second Indian restaurant I've tried in San Francisco. I was looking for something close to me, and after reading reviews I asked them for medium spicy food. The food was definitely hot. If you wanna be cute and say you've had "spicy" Indian food, this place is great - medium spicy will make you sweat. But this is not authentic Indian food. I don't want my mouth to be on fire when I ask for spicy. I want to enjoy a flavorful mix of spices. I was disappointed, but not surprised.
author: Dhruvi B.

description:
This place is excellent. It isn't expensive and makes really good food. Ask for Medium Plus spicy level if you like spicy food.

I really missed great indian food when I moved down to SF. So happy to find this place!
author: Steven G.

description: Suuuuuper family friendly amazing host and staff  we love this place and SO PROUD its on our neighborhood! It's authentic and fast and absolutely delicious
author: PalmasGirl P.

description:
When they say SPICY they mean SPICY!

Aloo chaat was great. Nice mix of flavors and the vegetables were cooked well. Mango lassi was good (I mean it would be sad if they screwed that up.)

Navratan Korma was okay. We got it medium and it was still quite spicy. I found it a bit lacking, however, in the non-hot spices. So spicy, but not really what I would call well spiced. I also didn't really pick up the creamy element that I would like for a korma.

Up to now, I'd be at four stars, but oh my god. BF and I got the channa masala on the high spice end. That was a mistake. Like, it was so spicy as to be inedible. Literally. We both had a bite and then gave up because the food was so drenched in chilies that it was impossible to taste anything but heat. I like spicy food and my BF really likes spicy food and I can say that I've never been to a restaurant where I've found something to be so spicy as to be inedible. 

You might think 'but you can't deduct a star because you're bad at ordering', and I say 'Maybe. Whatever.' The food is pretty good, not great, and the spice is out of control.
author: Tom Z.

description: We got the sag paneer and chicken tikka kabab. It was surprisingly good. We loved the homestyle taste and freshness to the food.
author: Kem K.

description:
They have a vegan menu! By that I mean a printed and laminated list of menu items that comprise a whole 8.5 x 11 sheet of paper, not a server who can recite one or two dairy free-options. Amazing! 

Lest you worry that the options are plenty but the fare is lacking, I can assure you that this isn't the case. The food is beautifully prepared and delicious. The baseline level of spiciness is not that hot, but I imagine they'd turn up the heat a bit (or a lot) if asked.

As others have noted, the space is teeny. Get takeout or go on off hours, or you'll be waiting around for awhile.
author: Janna M.

description: Amazing!! Rita is the best! She is friendly and attentive but not overly. Great service. Chicken tika Masala was delicious with large chunks of moist and tender chicken. Byrani rice with lamb was flavorful and thankfully lacked those hard seeds and spices that sometimes can chip your teeth. The special lamb samosas had the best dough surrounding the ground perfectly spiced lamb inside. Tandoori chicken was tender and delicious. I can't forget the Naan! It was buttery and delicious. I highly recommend getting the garlic naan in addition to the regular naan. The ambiance was cozy. There were even a few parties with small children and it was still very comfortable. We have found our new favorite Indian restaurant!
author: Rose S.

description: Came here for dinner on a Friday night. The restaurant is fairly small, but we were seated right away when we arrived around 6pm. Service was excellent. I ordered the chicken tikka masala (mild) and it was the least creamy tikka masala I've had, though still delicious. I will say that the curries are pretty spicy. The waitress explained that "medium" will make you break into a sweat, and we found that to be true!
author: Emma W.

description: Love the focus on high quality ingredients: saag has spinach flavor and beautiful deep green color, not dominated by butter and cream. Way too often crutches in restaurant Indian food.
author: Tony C.

description: Really, really subpar indian food. They claimed the food would be really spicy (as we had requested) and it was just completely tasteless. The only reason I reviewed it with 2 stars is the service was very prompt and friendly.
author: Ashwini B.

description:
This place is the bees knees! Freshly made curries in a family-run cozy environment.

When this place burned down a few years ago I was sad. They had a sign saying they would open soon, but I was worried. Every once in a while I would call their main number and hope that they would pick up. One day they answered and I headed straight down!

I almost always get the lamb achar, which is tangy and a spice level that can be modified to taste. In general they are spicier than a typical indian restaurant. "Mild" would be a "Medium" in most other places. So if you want "Mild" you probably need to specify that you don't want much heat at all.

I however love heat, and when we first went there years ago, I jokingly asked the lovely waitress to "go to the kitchen and slap the chef and say that I don't believe he can make it too spicy". She replied that was her dad, so she wouldn't slap him, but would relay the information. He didn't disappoint. Even though it was really spicy, and my face flushed, it still tasted great. Which some chili heads will understand that takes skill to walk that line.

I try to go back at least once a month, and I hesitate to give them such a good review, as their restaurant is not that large, and I don't want to have to wait forever for a table. But they certainly deserve it, and I can be patient.
author: David V.

description: Saffron grill is a great place to try food that is pretty close to home cooked food. I tried the Choley and the paneer makhani. Choley reminded me of the Choley my mum would cook at home. The food isn't too oily, there is no added color and tastes great. But believe her when she says the spice will make you sweat. In spite of being Indian and used to eating the spice , after a few bites I was sweating. I wished I had ordered mild and not medium spicy. I think the chillies were a little too much and after a point all I tasted was the spice. So go here - order mild and enjoy a nice home cooked indian meal.
author: Priyanka P.

description:
good!I love foods from here. 
spicy but tasty!!
and customer service is very nice,too.
Thank you for good foods and services Saffron Grill.
author: Keiko W.

description:
This is our neighborhood gem =)  I love the food, I love the people, I love the service, I love the prices!  It's family owned too.

Make sure to try the Chicken Chaat (appetizer but I sometimes order it for dinner as my entree because it's so good).  I couldn't really taste the difference between the onion naan and the garlic naan.  They both tasted phenomenal though.

Tip:  If I'm not in the mood for pizza at Fly Bar, sometimes I will just grab a quick to-go item from Saffron Grill and walk over to Fly Bar next door and eat it there with their more extensive beer/drink selection.
author: Emily T.

description: This place is the biggest let down of all Indian restaurants. It appeared cozy and you would expect a home-cooked meal. But if you come in thinking you'll get Indian food, you're wrong. You will get an American-style flavor of Indian food with no complexity or depth. So when you are home from work and craving succulent chicken tikka masala or refreshing raita, go elsewhere (most likely a whole in the wall like Shalimar) because this place will give you Blue Balls!
author: Neil S.

description: SO very disappointed with this meal. I have eaten Indian food all over the world and more importantly all over San Francisco and this was a real let down. Given the yelp review, I had high hopes. While my food order arrived in less than 45 minutes, my pappadam order was not included, the food was only warm, the naan bread was doughy and undercooked. The lam korma was hard with only a few chunks that were too big and hard to even cut, the butter chicken tasted like tomato sauce and had a few skinny strips of chicken. It was very disappointing and I will likely not order from here again.
author: Emma B.

description: Pretty mediocre Chicken Tikka Masala , but good Garlic Naan. We ordered delivery via Yelp and it turns out we had to email back for a refund on the Chai they couldn't deliver. I'd say average, overall.
author: Avery A.

description:
This is one of my favorite Indian restaurants in the Bay Area. It's a little on the pricey side otherwise I'd eat there a couple a times a week. It's a cozy , family run joint around the corner from Alamo Square. They also deliver!

The veggie samosas are fresh and spicy. A lot of cheaper places in the Mission use frozen samosas, but Saffron Grill makes theirs from scratch.

Amazing chutney. Enjoyed the Navratan Korma, but wished the sauce was a little thicker. The keema naan (w/ spicy lamb) also stood out. Oh and I adore their rice pudding. I dream about it and wake up craving it.
author: Taylor C.

description:
3.5 stars, but with my general rule of 4 stars  being that I would recommend it to a friend, this passes, so rounding up.

I've been there twice.  Ambiance is quite nice.  Small place, very homey.  Mango lassi is always a hit.  Pricing is a bit on the expensive side, but not badly.

THEY LIKE SPICY!!!  I normally order things Medium, and I did that the first time I was there.  Could not finish my food because it was wayyy too spicy.  Second time I was there, we got everything mild.  This was much much better.  The chicken dish I had still had a nice bit of spice to it, but it didn't make me cry.  

Not the best place ever.  Definitely not worth traveling for the way I would for a 5 star place.  But if you're in the neighborhood, and looking for Indian, this is a great choice.

B+
author: Chris A.

description:
This place is the great, a little on the pricey side though. Everything is a la carte so the check adds up at the end of the night.

The restaurant itself is very cozy, probably not good for larger groups, but perfect for a dinner date! The inside is nicely decorated in warm colors with art hanging on all the walls.

The service was amazing! Our server was a sweet woman who wasn't afraid to joke with us when she felt it was appropriate. She also was super helpful in helping us order dishes that would go well with our wine and beer.

After we ordered we were brought a super thin and crispy piece of flat bread (more like a giant thin chip) with dipping sauce. 

Our meals arrived shortly after and the Naan bread was was absolutely to die for. I honestly could have made an entire meal of the naan bread and the dipping sauce they bring with the crispy chip.

We ordered curry dishes, which were phenomenal and also veryyyy spicy! The food was also very fresh tasting with no excess of oil, butter or anything greasy or unhealthy. Definitely a great place to go to enjoy authentic and healthy food.
author: Lizette C.

description:
Absolutely my favorite north indian restaurant in SF and it's not just because I live around the block.
Really what I've been looking for is not what we call spicy food, but well-spiced food. Food that has a good variety of flavors, it doesn't have to heave the heat. Indian food is not necessarily meant to be "spicy" (break into a sweat kinda spicy), it's meant to be well spiced.
Here's the thing, when you order and they ask you how spicy, the medium is pretty darn "spicy" (I always get the medium at other restaurants). By that I mean, you'll be reaching for water/sweating. Every now and then, I enjoy that kind of heat but the second time around I got the regular/mild and I LOVED the food. I found this to be one of the only places in SF that I've had indian food that does justice to making the food "well-spiced". 
The man likes the malai kofta a lot, I really like the mutter panner but I can't imagine anything else on the menu being bad.
A plus - the staff is so nice and friendly!
author: Shruti T.

description:
I used to really like this place, but I'll never eat here again.

Simply for the fact that whoever just spoke to me on the phone was so completely rude.  I have probably ordered from this place 100 times before, and the food is decent, not great by any stretch of the imagination, but decent.  But life's too short to spend your money on assholes, so congratulations dude whoever just spoke to me on the phone, you've just lost a customer for life.  Nice job.  It's ok though because your tikka masala sucked anyway.  The one time I ordered it I actually wondered if the chicken had been cooked or not.  Good riddance, I guess.
author: Juan P.

description: REOPENED!  I ate there tonight and it was as GOOD as EVER!  Stop by and remind yourself of how awesome this place deliciously is!
author: Jenn D.

description: Boring Indian food that is masked by overly spicy sauces. It's claustrophobic and ecchoey in there. The setup is awkward. If you're seated anywhere near the door there will a bunch of slobs standing around waiting for their pick-up. Last thing you want when you're eating is someone's dirty jeans in your face.
author: Lola P.

description: Great Lamb Achar!!!! Devoured it.  Will be ordering again, maybe Chicken Achar :-)
author: Caryn S.

description: Love the Saffron Grill. Great Indian cuisine, inexpensive bottles of wine, very cozy, clean restaurant with a friendly waitstaff. I feel like family when I go to the Saffron Grill. Nice date spot too!
author: Ben R.

description:
Yummmm!!! Great service from a hilarious server and awesome food!! Everything we ordered tasted fresh and was not overly drenched in heavy sauces. If you decide to try this place here are a few tips to take into consideration:

1) This place is SMALL. that being said this wouldn't be the place for a romantic date as you are literally breathing down other diner's backs. Also, because its so cramped, you will need to shed those layers typical of any San Franciscan's attire. It gets pretty warm in here.

2) Protions are not that big. Granted my boyfriend can eat more than his share of any entree in the history of restaurants, but we ordered several dishes that were delicious yes, but still had more sauces than meat. For $13 bucks minimum an entree, that can get pretty steep for two starving people.

3) Spicy really means spicy,  exercise caution!

Great place to dine if you've had a late lunch and dont want something heavy for dinner, not so good if you come ravenous.
author: Gabriella C.

description: There are so many good restaurants in San Francisco and this place is no exception. We went past dinner-time which provided us table space for the five of us. The place is small but had such a cute atmosphere. We ordered five to six items so I don't remember the specific entrees that we ordered. The foods were ALL great. The seasonings were spicy and very flavourful. I enjoyed the foods here very much and if I was living in SF, I would definitely come here all the times.
author: Thy T.

description:
Not too bad. Went around 5pm, I think my wife and I were the only ones in there.

Prompt service, decent food.

AMBIANCE
It's a cramped place with a tiny TV hanging from the ceiling. The bathroom is so small, you have to suck in your gut to spin around. I find that kinda thing pretty charming. Saffron Grill isn't pretending to be something it's not.

FOOD
Saag was excellent. It was unique. I've never tasted saag with such a fresh taste. Almost like it had parsley in it or something.

Navvratahn Korma (basically a creamy veggie dish) was pretty watery. I wouldn't order it again.

Chicken Tikka was very spicy, but the taste was good. It wasn't too spicy to eat.

Not necessarily my go-to Indian joint, but if I was looking to stuff my face with some Indian and not get too fussy about it, Saffron does the trick.
author: Shawn S.

description:
We called in our order for take-out and when we arrived, it was ready to go.  Also, it was delicious! 

-small inside (I would probably not eat here, but just order take-out.)
-fast, but semi-impersonal, service
-above average Indian food, but nothing spectacular
author: Larissa A.

description:
Hands down the best Indian restaurant I have ever been to in my entire life. I had no clue something as dominant as the spices used in Indian cooking can still showcase the freshness and flavors of the ingredients. I guess I've just never hit up a LEGIT Indian restaurant my entire life (no surprise). Thank you Saffron Grill for opening my eyes and blowing my mind!

We ordered the mango lassi, garlic naan, chicken tikka masala, and the sag prawns.

The sag prawns, normally supposed to be a creamy spinach base was unlike any I have ever had. It wasn't just mushy creamed spinach. I could actually taste the crispness of the spinach alongside the creaminess of the curry... How trippy is that??

And the curry here definitely does not feel like thick curry broth with meat floating inside. There was a perfect balance of vegetables, spices, meat, and sauce. 

Waitress was as pleasant and humorous as ever recommending dishes to a noob like me, and the food came so much faster than expected! A delightful surprise for something so freshly made.

I was never a huge fan of Indian food until you, Saffron Grill. You are forever my first Indian love. And thank you for somehow magically not leaving my clothes smelling like Indian food after my dinner.
author: Huan L.

description:
Butter (Makhani) Chicken.  I must have it whenever I'm at an Indian eatery.  You could say my entire rating system would be based on that one dish and that one dish alone.  If you screw that up, your out faster than Heidi could say avita zein.  

I'm happy to say it passed.  Certainly not the best I've had but good enough to satisfy my needs.  We also ordered a lamb dish.  Sorry, I can not recall the name but I asked her to make her specialty.  The lamb was tender and a-ok.  We also got an order of naan (must dip in butter chicken sauce), basmati rice, and the assorted appetizer (2 pcs of samosas and veg pakoras - veg pakoras was scrumptious).

Portions, like at most higher end Indian restaurants (although you wouldn't be able to tell by their interior) are rather minuscule.  I was, however, satisfied as I've had smaller (like you wouldn't believe).  Service, or as my hubs liked to call her Pusher, was great.  I know how to handle those pesky dealers or um servers so it was rather amusing.
 
Saffron grill = good if your in the hood!
author: Stephanie E.

description:
This place has gone downhill. It was one of my favorite places. The service, efficiency, well-trained, and hard work people seem to be missing now. 

Funny thing is that they are the same owners cooking here!  Only exception is that the hostess/waitress (daughter of owner) is missing since her child has been born.  You now see the laziness and efficiency of those remaining and newly hired in the front.

When we arrived, we were seated and waited over 5 minutes to get menus.  We had to waive the waitress down to get our orders in when we were ready.  We did not get water or asked what we would like to drink when order was taken.  We received our water 10-15 minutes later.  We waited 45 minutes for our entrees.  Wow!  This place has always been busy, so I can not say that's the reason we got our food so late or the scattered brains of the front.  We have been here numerous times and had no issues before.

Menu have changed and there are no longer combo meals.  So sad!  People who had take-out orders ended up waiting for an additional 20 minutes when they arrived.  That really does not make sense to me.  I wouldn't even go to the restaurant until the allotted time the restaurant has indicated the food will be ready for pick-up.  

Our food was lukewarm (chicken vindaloo, fish masala, basmati rice).  Only dish that was hot was the garlic naan.  I also see that the people in the front do not know how to multi-task with various tables.  I have been a waitress and even know better than this.  The front are obviously not well-trained or seasoned restaurant front people.
author: Linda C.

description:
Love it here! 

The food is perfect (and there are healthy options that I really like!).

The staff is friendly and intuitive. They are great at suggesting things I enjoy.
author: Jason B.

description:
Even though I get Indian food delivered to my house often, I've only been to the nearby Saffron Grill once in the last two years since I moved into the Nopa area. After getting some take out the other day, I'm reminded why. 

We ordered the Channa Masala, Chicken Coconut Curry and the Sag Lamb and most were disappointing. The chicken curry was pretty good actually but the masala and lamb were under seasoned, bland and there were only a few pieces of lamb. Considering that this place is pretty pricey for what you get, I was expecting much more. 

Bland, overpriced Indian food is one thing, but me and my dinner-mate got really sick that night and the next day. I'm talking my-stomach-is-in-so-much-pain-that-I'd-rather-not-have-it sick due to this food. 

Maybe I'll give it another shot in a few years
author: Marin P.

description:
This is a pretty sweet Indian restaurant.  I'd say 80% of the good vibes from the experience came from our server, who picked all of our dishes and seemed genuinely interested in our enjoyment of our meal.

The food was quite excellent as well.  It's been over a month since I visited, so I can't remember any specific standouts.  I do recall that the food was a notch spicier than I'm used to (which is a good thing for me, but you might want to take that into account in your order).
author: Bill H.

description: This place has just reopened from a fire last December. It has gotten even better. The food is full of love and impeccable. The service and owners are warm and friendly. A true hidden gem. Try the achar and the specials when they are available. Also not to miss are the Indian pickles, lentil soup and rice pudding. Very small space, so a wait is possible, but there's a bar next door!
author: Aaron W.

description: Love this neighborhood spot. Usually just do delivery but finally went in to eat and was very impressed. Great friendly service
author: Richard K.

description: This place is the spot for an authentic Indian kitchen run by a cool family. I came here off of a four star yelp rating and had to give it five. If 4 of us ate dinner (mutton briyani, Dahl, saag, and coconut chicken) for $60 for food of this quality it deserves 5 stars. Not to mention the service was outstanding (food quick and plates cleaned and water refilled multiple times) the on tap water (all I drink) was filtered and tasted great. The small  size of the restaurant creates an intimate ambiance. I'll definitely be back and will take more of my friends.
author: Tumi M.

description: two of the items I ordered, the saag panner and korma were disgusting and inedible. I have had korma before and this was frozen Costco veggies boiled in old milk.  I will never order from them again.
author: Erica N.

description:
This place is the best. Their food already starts off pretty spicy, but I'm a world champion spicy-food-eater, so whenever I go, I demand that the chef make my dish "so spicy that my kid's kids start sweating." The matriarch of the place always obliges.

One time, my roommates decided to give their orders an ultra spicy kick. No one could eat more than 2 or 3 spoonfuls of their dish before tapping out. I ended up finishing all their food as they sat there, looking bitter and sweating like they were sitting in a Russian bathhouse.
author: Leo K.

description:
Last weekend I ordered dinner to go from the Saffron Grill.  It was excellent and just confirmed to me how much I love this place.  I had Saag Paneer, Samosas, Rice, Naan and Riata.

Again, the paneer was super fresh and the saag was really different than I am used to.  Not as creamy and the ingredients tasted more distict than most paneers.  Loved the onion in it.  

Naan cooked to perfection and fresh raita.  They give you a lot of rice so that you can make 2 or three meals out of your one entree.  The food tasted even better the next day.

Everything was nicely packaged and ready to go when I got there.

Please Saffron Grill.... Add Paneer Tikka Korma to your menu and I'll never go to another Indian restaurant in the city.  Or offer it as a special and let me know.  I'll be there.
author: Cynthia R.

description:
+3 stars for very tasty Samosas, very light and tasty Saag Paneer.

+2 For great service. Very friendly.

It's a tiny place, so adjust your expectations accordingly.
author: Mark S. I.

description: Unfortunately it seems this place has burned down & is no longer in business :(
author: linda t.

description:
Picked up samosa, chicken kabob and chole - everything was super fresh! Unreal for an Indian place - place has completely earned its 4* rating. Samosas are hand-made at the restaurant - not ordered from somewhere else and reheated, which is typical Indian restaurant tactic. And the prices were also reasonable!! 

Good, casual place - w/ above casual quality! :)
author: Bhavin M.

description: I recently had takeout from Saffron Grill. I'm not exactly sure why there are so many positive reviews. We had garlic naan, saag prawns, and aloo gobi. The naan is very doughy and barely has a char to the bottom. The saag prawns and aloo gobi were fine, just bland as in needing salt and more spices. I've definitely had much better versions (well, regular saag paneer) at other places. With so many restaurants in SF, I would skip this one at least for takeout. Maybe dining in is better.
author: Michael W.

description: This is an awesome low-key, family owned restaurant. SUPER nice staff, great quality food, and intimate atmosphere. Awesome to see this business come back after suffering from a fire!
author: Aaron M.

description:
I love that the restaurant is a small, friendly business, but ultimately my dinning experience resulted in disappointment. 

I can't remember the names of our apps because I left those up to my bf, however, one of them involved meat and when it was served to us it was barely lukewarm. We weren't sure if the dish was intended to be served cold or hot (not a good sign), but the temperature made us both pass on eating the possibly "left out for a long time" tempered meat.

Unfortunately, when our entrees arrived we were served lukewarm seek kabob. Room temperature meat again, bah! I chose mattar paneer for my main and found the sauce to be too thin for my taste. Some may prefer a thinner sauce, if you do... this is your place. Overall the dinner was a flop.
author: Miss B.

description:
Reasonably priced and the food is great. Ordered coconut curry chicken, lamb curry, naan and raita. The raita helped with the lamb curry which was medium (aka really spicy). Lots of flavor without being too salty or too heavy. 

Like other reviewers have stated, the spiciness level is one level higher than normal (I usually take a medium, but here have to request mild). 

Service is also superb - the owner? is really friendly and the rest of the staff are pretty friendly too. You can tell they have a lot of regulars and they interact with them like friends, remembering their orders, asking them what they did last weekend, did they take that trip they said they would, what about the kids, etc.  The restaurant is small and intimate so it really encourages that atmosphere. 

Will have to come here again!
author: Victoria K.

description: Amazing Indian food! Not greasy, full of flavors and fresh; each time. My husband and I drive from RWC for their food and we're picky with food!
author: Nikki P.

description:
I ordered take-out a couple of nights ago, from Saffron Grill, via GrubHub.

After my previous experience at the restaurant, I was looking forward to a satisfying meal. I ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala, and the Tandoori Shrimp. The online ordering process was very easy, the delivery was prompt, and the delivery guy was courteous & friendly. However, the food was TERRIBLE! The Tandoori Shrimp comprised a few shrimp doused in some anonymous spices, and the Chicken Tikka Masala - normally one of my favorites - was bland, verging on the inedible. Very disappointing, all the more so because I had such a positive experience eating in at the restaurant. 

My hope is that the take-out meal is not the same (for whatever reason) as what is served in the restaurant. (Another cause of the "GrubHub Curse" -- all my ordering experiences through GrubHub, while ideal for such an Internet-savvy geek as myself, have been disappointing food experiences.) So -- so more take-out. I will try the restaurant again, though now I am fairly apprehensive...
author: donal c.

description: We went there for a small reunion. The food was great and the service was fantastic. Everything was on time. Nice restaurant in a nice neighborhood.  Definitely recommend  this place.
author: Richard R.

description: I came in on a saturday night and based on the prices of individual dishes I expected decent portions and amazing flavors.  I ordered the chicken tikka masala and vegetarian dal. Ehhh. Nothing amazing and not disgusting. For the price I expected more and for the 4 stars everyone else gives I expected better flavors. Probably wouldn't come back but if you live in the area it'd fill your indian food fix if you couldn't go anywhere else.
author: Linda L.

description:
I ordered takeout -- samosas, garlic bread, and chicken tikka kebab. The samosas were decent, the garlic bread wasn't really anything special, and the chicken was dry and not really that great.

So food-wise, this is a 3-star place. It lost one more star for me because of the SERVICE. I don't demand much from a takeout experience -- but the guy who took my order was pretty rude (fine, whatever, maybe they're busy). The same guy was there when I showed up - he yelled at me when I didn't understand right away that he wanted me to scan the existing orders on the table (he had asked for my name, I assumed the orders would be labeled... but no). I waited an extra 5 minutes (order was ready in 30 minutes instead of the promised 20), paid my bill, and left.
author: Tyche T.

description:
I'm ashamed to say I've lived two blocks down the street from this place for years now and this is the first time I've tried it.  Came here with some friends the other night and was blown away by the quality of the food.  It's a TINY place, but it has a great "small neighborhood restaurant" feel.  The waitress was one of the most personable I can remember having in a long time, and the place just has that feel of a place that you want to support and dine at often.

Anyway, we ordered several dishes as we usually do at Indian restaurants, but ended up only being able to eat a little more than half due to their more than ample portions (those bowls are deeper than they look).  The waitress asked us if we wanted it spicy, and upon saying yes, this is one of the first times in a while that I can remember getting Indian food where they really did properly spice everything.  The fish masala was wonderfully moist and tender, while the chicken vindaloo made you sweat just the way you expect.  The only negative comment came from my friend who felt that the spinach in the saag paneer came from a can, but honestly I thought it was quite tasty (he's a bit pickier than he should be).  Oh, and great naan too.

Anyway, it's great to have this business in our neighborhood and I'll be dining here again soon.
author: Joshua W.

description:
Amazing Indian food with spunky service.  If you like it hot, you can get it here!  It's my fav and go-to India restaurant in the city. They also do delivery and take out.

I've been impressed with all the dishes I've ordered: Veg Samosas, Chicken Achar, Aloo Gobi, Yellow Dal, Channa Masala, Chicken Tikka Masala, Veg/Chicken Biryani, Chicken Vindaloo.  The nan, roti and parathas are also top notch. You can't go wrong.

Get a mago lassi to cool off your taste buds.... mmmmmmmm... I am now leaving to go eat here again!
author: Jessica P.

description:
Don't go to Saffron Grill. Ever. Please.

If you go, then your friends will go. And if they go, then their friends will go and so on and so on. There are only 8 to 10 tables in the whole place, so space is at a premium.

That being said, I love love love love this restaurant for all of the reasons anyone loves a restaurant:

-Service: I feel like I've known these people forever. I felt that way the first time I ever stepped in. Warm, friendly, funny, charming.  There are only a few tables and service isn't in your face...when they're at your table, they are focused on YOU. It's lovely.

-Food: Oh. My. God. I LOVE Indian food. It might be my favorite. I'm always in a battle between my tastebuds and my stomach...my mouth screaming for more and my stomach begging for mercy. This is by far the best Indian food I've ever had. FRESH, beautifully spiced, authentic and made with love. Not too heavy on the ghee, either, which is really nice.

-Ambiance: Like I said, it's teeny tiny. But it's cozy and warm and has lovely decor. It's simple and sort of romantic. 

Value: The combos are divine! SO much food and the portions are perfect for sharing. 

But, I beg you not to go to Saffron Grill. Stay away. Don't tell anyone about it if you DO go. It's a hidden gem for a reason.
author: Amber M.

description:
What a nice, homey-feeling surprise (homey as in like home, not d. clown). Saffron's a great neighborhood Indian restaurant with a warm feel inside, shared with other comfort-food appreciators and Indian food lovers.

We got the fish curry and lamb sag, both quite good, paired with garlic naan and roti (which were fairly average - my fiance makes just as good ones). Our friends got the chicken tikka masala, which I would say were a little above average. If I ever feel like a casual Indian, this is where I'll go.
author: Stephen H.

description: Tried Saffron Grill tonight and ordered for delivery. When the order taker asked how spicy, I said medium because I kind of like spicy as long as its not bitter. Ordered some lamb kebab, samosa, chicken anchar, chicken biryani etc. I found the food to okay but whatever they used to make things spicy was a bit bitter. Mango chutney was an extra charge. Like I said it's not bad but I've experienced better at other places nearby.
author: Manny Y.

description:
FIVE STARS YOU ROCK. when i type in best indian food in sf this claims the place. it truly is the indian food in san francisco that is prepared cooked and served with LOVE. 
other words to describe saffron grill:
intimate. 
spicy.
entertaining.
warm.
wholesome.
relaxed.

= the best place to eat the best food. what are you waiting for?!
author: Libra J.

description: Food here is excellent. The owner is very funny too.  The place is small but have good sitting for couples.
author: Dash F.

description:
Awesome find!

As others have said, Saffron is a really tiny restaurant. But it's worth the wait if necessary (I didn't have to wait at all early one Saturday evening). 3 friends and I went and possibly ordered everything on the menu. 

We tried lots of different breads - get the combo basket! The saag paneer and other veggie dish we had were also delicious. 

Overall, the restaurant has a very family feel - like you've gone to your Indian family's house for dinner -- that, paired with that bread basket is why I'll be back!
author: Gretchen S.

description: They're 45 minute delivery time was actually 23 minutes. I haven't been inside the confines of the place, and have ordered delivery twice nice -- and the same exact order as their house specialty Lamb Achar is this nutty dish of pickled meat, pickled peppers & spices. They also have a dish of tomato / lamb inside naan, and a naan with raisins, nuts & cherries. For a cuisine that can get pretty tired with vindaloo this tikka masala that, they're offering some different dishes that keeps my late night weekend lazy situation of "I AM NOT COOKING" cravings. Plus, I have no idea how to make Indian food, let alone this cray Achar dish.
author: Jon A.

description: I ordered for delivery and it came very quickly. My Indian friends never want to eat out (I am not Indian) and I never understood why and now I understand why. The food was OK. It did have a fair amount of spice which I did like, but everything sort of tasted the same (butter chicken, prawn coconut curry and channa masala). I happen to know how to make butter chicken and I can make it much better than this (sorry). the prawns - there might have been 5 prawns swimming in a sea of mushy liquid. It was all edible but I guess I was expecting really good Indian food. The WORST part was the rice - it came in chunks - and a lot of it was burned so I had chunky burnt rice like it had been sitting in the bottom of a pan for hours (days?) - I cannot believe they actually sent this out to a customer.
author: karin d.

description:
We tried Saffron Grill today for lunch for the first time.  The service was friendly and prompt. It is a tiny space, but it so bright and clean and happy that it felt very welcoming.

The food: We had chicken tikka masala, saag paneer, channa masala, naan, rice, and raita.

We found the flavors to be delicate and layered. Delicious!  The tikka masala was more sweet than hot, so it may have been done with a bit more of a bite, but it's overall flavor was fantastic!

The saag paneer and the channa masala were perfect.  The spinach seemed fresh and flavorful and was in good balance with the spices. The paneer had a firm, pleasant texture and every several bites included a piece of pickled ginger that was such a nice compliment!

We found the naan to be fluffy and hearty. Nothing was greasy as sooo many Indian restaurants in this city are. 

The chai was also delicious, and was not pre-sweetened which was a refreshing change.

We will be back, again and again and again!
author: Heather S.

description: Unfortunately, this was the worst ordering experience my wife and I have ever had.  Wrong order, late delivery, cold food.  Its too bad, we used to support this place, but since being treated so poorly we will never give business to Saffron.  Poor service and overpriced mediocre food.
author: Mark L.

description:
Not sure why this place got 4 stars on Yelp..very misleading.

I was really excited to come here since I am a big fan of Indian food but the experience was just an overall disappointment. 

The restaurant is very small and they are very short staffed so service definitely suffered. The food took a while to come out.

The vegetable samosas finally arrived and were really good. Awesome flavor and great texture.

The dishes we ordered were bland and had a weird puree-ed consistency. We had ordered the chicken coconut curry, chicken vindaloo, and potatoes and onions in masala sauce...I have had much better at Indian restaurants in Orange County and San Diego.
author: Jenn L.

description:
This review has been lying as a draft for way to long..
This place is really good.. I always order takeaways and have loved it every time.. pretty legit Indian food.. 
.. and the lady in charge of the place is really nice.. she gave me a free gulab jamun the last time i went there (my 5th or 6th time)
they should try making the place a little bigger.. its way to small right now..
author: Aditya M.

description:
ok. I have lived in this neighborhood for a year and walked by this place a hundred times. From the outside it doesnt look like anything special, but NOT TRUE!! SOOO Good!! Dont walk by again! go in!!

So I finally I came here with a party of 4 friends. We ordered 2 bottles of Pinot which was way decent for the price, The assorted Appetizer,( veg Pakorasa were my fav), the Classic Lamb curry, Chicken tikka masala, Yellow dahl, And Sag Paneer, rice and Naan to split between the 4 of us. ALL of this came out to only $30 per person for dinner and I left feeling satisfied, stuffed and even had a lil wine buzz goin :) Every dish was great and the Waitress is very energetic and fun.

I will absolutely be back!
author: Lisa M.

description: Excellent neighborhood spot. Some of the best Indian food I've had in the city at reasonable prices. So happy that the've reopened after the fire.
author: Andrew J.

description: SO GOOD, SO NICE. Really relaxed awesome vibe and amazing food. First time here and I'll be back very soon.... the staff is great too.
author: Jack D.

description:
Try the chicken soup with lemon. The best combination of flavor I've ever had in a soup...it is simple perfect... I also loved the garlic naan, Lamb curry and Saag Panner....everything was great.

I live one block from this retaurant and I've never noticed it there. I'll definitely come back soon. 

The place is small though...however, it makes it intimate and cozy...
author: Taís C.

description:
We've gotten take-out from here a few times and it's been great every time. (Sidenote: kind of grossed out with myself that I say "we" in almost every review I've done). 

My usual is the Prawn Masala combo which comes with rice, Naan, and rice pudding. I possibly have the lowest tolerance in the world for any kind of spice, and this Prawn Masala dances a savory line of just the right amount of heat and too much heat. I guess that means if you really love the spicy stuff, it won't be hot enough for you, or I suppose you could just ask for it to be hotter than the norm.

Any time I almost get into a death match with my significant other over the last piece of Naan means that it must be really good shit or we're just a couple of fatties. I'm inclined to believe it is a combination of the two. 

I was, however, pretty disappointed with my last order because they were out of yogurt and thus couldn't make me a Mango Lassi. Like, really disappointed. It's still too soon; I don't think I can talk about it anymore.
author: Lilia M.

description: Food was really bad. We had a group of 7 who came hoping for good Indian good based on rating. Definitely won't recommend. Such restaurants bring a bad name to Indian food in USA. I was also charged for a chicken we returned. I would have given this a 0 star. Don't waste your money here
author: V V.

description: Intimate and family owned neighborhood Indian restaurant. Service is attentive and friendly without fail and I've tried many of the menu items, all delicious. Saffron grill has become my favorite Indian stop in the bay--I've brought many guests there and they've all loved it!
author: Mel M.

description:
Yummy Indian with a friendly & homey feel! Kind of like eating dinner in someone's living room! Short wait on a Friday night at 8pm so we grabbed sangria at fly bar before they called us in. 

Standouts were definitely samosas and garlic naan. They do know how to make a good spicy dish served up right in here, but please note that the tikka masala sauce is not the creamy kind (i prefer creamy, but this was easier on the stomach). It is like the pure tomato kind. At least this was the case with the fish tikka masala. As for service, a really cool  friendly chick was (wo)manning the entire place, and she did it quite well. 

My friend had the lamb kabob and my boyfriend had her leftovers later. Apparently the flavor was good but it was a little dry. So three people ate for the price of two = hearty portions!
author: Shannon R.

description:
This is a cute little restaurant, very cozy. We were impressed by the delicious aloo gobi and garlic naan, although the chicken tikka masala was a little bland. 

Maybe we're ruined by the cheap Indian food in the Mission, but the bill surprised us. Two entrees, beers and naan is over $50?

But seriously, order the aloo gobi. I nearly licked the plate.
author: Steph M.

description:
A cozy restaurant with very yummy food.  They deliver which is great, although a trip to the restaurant is much more fun.  The portion sizes are decent - and I have pretty much loved any dish I have ordered.

The real star of the restaurant is Rita, though.  She is so much fun, a little bit spunky - and a perfect host for this place.  Don't miss it - you really feel like you have walked into someone's house for dinner and end up having a great time.
author: Richard H.

description: If it wasn't for the wonderfully, fantastic waitress I'm not sure I'd come back. The food was okay it just felt bland, which is disappointing for Indian food. Sure their naan was good, their samosas were good, and their sides were good, but when it came down to it, their main dishes fell short. If you're nearby and looking for a quick-fix to your Indian food craving this place will do.
author: Eduardo R.

description:
My friends and I met there last night, just banking on it being a great place/neighborhood to meet because it's the middle of where we all live! Not expecting much from Saffron Grill I have to say that I've already recommended it to three people in less than 24 hours!

The service was so welcoming and overwhelmingly nice. The Chana Masala and garlic naan was a homerun!
author: Nicole d.

description:
Mmm that was some tasty stuff. 

Right after our funny and oh so kind waitress took our order, she brought out a complimentary, lentil thin-paperlike flatbread with two dipping sauces. The lentil thinger was light and flaky. The best part was the tamarind dipping sauce. A sweet delight. The other one was a green chilli type sauce which was a bit spicy for my palate. 

Our meal began with the Veggie Pakorasas and Veggie Samosas. Both fried perfectly. Was not dried and the filling was abundant of flavors. And no Samosa don't look but does tastes similar to Burmese Samusas. 

We had the bread basket which included the regular Nann, Potato/Pea Nann, and Onion Nann. The bread was used to dip the Chicken Tika Masala, Fish of the Day Masala, and Saag Paneer. All dishes were delicious. Orgasmic flavors with every bite! 

We were not able to make reservations, but got here at 7PM, great time before the crowd poured in. This places is tiny, literally. Many diners were from the neighborhood, as the waitress/waiter practically knew all the familiar faces that placed orders to go. The wait was not long from what I observed. Folks eat and go. No lounging around. Parking ain't that bad either in this area. 

This will be my new favorite restaurant...can't wait to come back!
author: Dee T.

description:
Saffron Grill is small, family-owned (I think), and very intimate (in a good way).  The whole place only seats like 20 or 25 people total.

The free appetizers were great: some thin crunchy bread and 2 different sauces.  The entrees were really good also, and our waitress was very friendly.
author: Michael B.

description:
The only problem with going to Saffron Grill is that I eat until I'm full, ask them to kindly box up my food, and then as soon as I get back to +1's apartment, all I want to do is dive right back into the leftovers.  Which is to say it's pretty tasty.

I've tried the chicken tikka masala (the only thing +1 will order), the butter chicken, the lamb korma, and chicken coconut curry.  All of them are tasty, although a word to the wise - if you get delivery, I found that the butter chicken gets a little watery from the condensation on the tupperware they put it in.

My favorite part of the restaurant, however, is the adorable young woman who seats people and takes orders - she is hilarious and seems to remember my +1 and I, though we go once a month.  Last night, she told us to look away as she turned on the LED "candle," soI remarked that the mood was suddenly so much more romantic.  She quipped, "let me know if you need me to turn it off."  I told her I'd alert her if the +1 stopped behaving.

Inside, it's tiny, but prettily decorated, with art from local artists for sale. The staff is super attentive and friendly, and the prices are generally reasonable.  And it's right by Fly Bar if you want to stop for a pre- or post-dinner drink!
author: Jennie K.

description: Ok yelpers you failed me on this one! We were at Divisadero during the art walk and everywhere had a long wait, then we found this place on yelp. First off we were in starvation mode so we thought Indian food it's usually premade sauces in the kitchen shouldn't take too long. Boy were we wrong! They took forever!!! I was ready to chew someone's face off I was so hungry. Then when the food came the dishes were so small! We ate the really good garlic naan, best part of the whole meal, in like 5 minutes and ordered a 2nd round (2nd round didn't show up until 20 minutes later or longer). The butter shrimp curry was blah, not enough flavor, Chicken Tikki Masala was good moist chicken, lamb dishes I didn't try. I've had alot of Indian food in my days and I was not happy at all with the food or the fat bill at the end! Rip off for what we got.
author: Karen T.

description:
I live just a couple blocks from this place and walk by it all the time. I finally ate here with my boyfriend a couple weeks ago and regretted not coming here sooner. The food was delicious! The naan was tasty and not too thin. The tandoori chicken was moist and had just the right amount of marinade on it and the curry prawns were amazing! Be sure to get a mango lassi if you have a sensitive stomach for Indian food!

Note: if you plan on coming during peak dinner hours, especially on the weekend, prepare for very slow service. The food is still amazing and worth the wait!
author: Jenee Y.

description: Decent Indian food.  Very cozy.  I'd go back.
author: Michael E.

description:
This has to be the smallest restaurant in town. I think the maximum capacity is about ten to twelve people for the whole spot, but as you walk in the spices in the air seduce you. 

It seems like it's a family run business which is aces with me, and they are very friendly and welcoming. I tend to like my Indian food on the spicy side so I was extremely happy that out of all the different dishes we ordered there wasn't a single one that was bland. 

Again, it does get a little crowded in this closet of a space, but the food makes it a delicious little whole in the wall spot.
author: Beth M.

description:
This place is delicious! I think their selection is actually on the limited side as far as curries go, but the usual staples are just so good it doesn't really matter. The pricing is relatively average, maybe $1 or $2 more than I'm used to seeing, however the portions were pretty generous. I ordered the chicken saag and some naan (their naan was fresh and had just the right chewy consistency).

I usually have a problem with ordering indian food because sometimes when I ask for it spicy, it doesn't turn out as spicy as I would have liked. Luckily, Saffron got it right when I said "seriously, make it spicy" and delivered the perfect amount of spice (enough to keep you going for your water, but not enough to kill you...).

One thing that Saffron does better than most is service. Their staff and genuinely friendly and try their hardest to be accommodating, even when the place is packed. I forgot my waitress' name, but she was a sweetheart who kept joking around with us. I've been to Indian restaurants where the waiter hasn't said more than two words to me, so a little goes a long way. 

The only downside to this place is that it is TINY. Seriously, so crowded! I ate here on a Friday night and I was literally back to back with the table behind me and there is only a narrow walkway from the front of the dining room to the back. There were also like, five babies eating there when I went, so the noise level is a little high.
author: Sabrina M.

description:
Neighborhood gem!  A perfect end to a perfect day!

It was the Fourth of July and the wine had been flowing since around noon.  The fog had rolled-in.  Fireworks were a bust.  So what are three drunken friends to do?  Fend off that hangover with Saffron Grille.

This family owned and operated North Indian restaurant seats all of 20 people.  Get there early or get there late because you will have to wait on the street if you get there at rush hour.  

The best service of any restaurant on the corner of Fulton and Divisadaro.  We have eaten in, taken out.  One time in a mad rush to pack for vacation, slash, a deperate attempt to not leave the house, they delivered!

I can't say enough good things about it.  You need to stop by one drunken eve and try it out.
author: Karsten R.

description:
*3.5*
Solid Indian food but nothing that blows your mind away or entice you to come back.  The lamb vindaloo is definitely HOT HOT HOT.  The chicken tikka masala was a bit dry and the sauce was a bit on the sweet side.  

On the plus side, the service is great.  The owner is so bubbly and warm.
author: E E.

description:
This is my absolute favorite Indian restaurant in SF. It's family-owned and ran by a great family, no less. The last time I was there, we spent an hour or so just talking with them after we were done with dinner.
