author: Stephanie V.

description:
9:30 on a Wednesday night.  What to order?
Little Star?  Pizza - predictable.
Jay's Cheesesteak - had it the day before.

Wanted something flavorful and that delivered.  Indian food?  Sure.  But where?

Whipped out the trusty Yelp mobile app, set search for indian food and 'current location'.  Viola!  Saffron Grill.

Quick delivery.  Tasty food.  Fish masala - yum.  Sag paneer, also quite delicious.  Lamb Biryani - aromatic and flavorful.

Also ordered the assorted appetizer.  Comes with 2 pieces of samosa and veg pakoras.  These were just okay.  Though I loved the mint dipping sauce.

Take note that if you say you want it spicy, it'll come SPICY.  I loved the heat, but after a bit it can quickly overwhelm the flavors.  But that was my bad.  Next time I'll tone it down.

All in all, great addition to my evening delivery repertoire.
author: Marcel C.

description: I love Indian food and quite picky about where I go (Naan and Curry is okay but it works for the budget conscious) and just found this place near my home. From the service to the food they did a great job. The chicken tika masala was amazing, the sag paneer was delicious and the garlic naan was perfect. I plan on taking some friends this week and I know they too will have a great experience. Definitely a little gem in the hood...
author: Olivia R.

description: Best Indian food in SF.  Every dish i have had I have cleaned the plate with complete satisfaction.
author: sherri c.

description: I have lived in the city for 3 years and been waiting to find a really good Indian restaurant that tastes like my mom's cooking.   I am very pleased to report that Saffron Grill is that Indian restaurant!  Most Indian places douse their food in butter and cream, making the food way too rich and unhealthy.  Saffron Grill is the first place I've been to that doesn't overdo the cream and still masters the flavor. Their Paneer Tikka, paneer makhani and saag paneer are the best I've ever tasted in an Indian restaurant.  Also, the staff is awesome! They are incredibly friendly and helpful, and willing to make accommodations for their customers.  I highly recommend this place!!
author: Swaicha C.

description: So good!!  Everything we've had on the menu so far has been great.  We often order delivery from them when we have guests in town and everyone always love it.  The Channa Masala is excellent.  We ordered it very spicy and it was!  We are working our way through the rest of the menu and haven't been let down yet.  So far we've tried the Chicken Tikka Masala, Lamb Achar, Chicken Masala, and Sag Paneer.  Its a bit pricey for the portions, but worth it for the delicious food.
author: Jill G.

description:
As a New Yorker (where excellent Indian restaurants number in the hundreds), I had trouble finding a reliable Indian place when I arrived here about a year ago.
Not any longer, as Saffron Grill has become a weekly indulgence.  The family that owns and operates this place is super nice and the food is excellent.  
Don't miss the naan, butter chicken, malai kofta curry, saag paneer and lamb achar.
author: Matt S.

description:
I used to live a few blocks away from Saffron Grill. Being a lover of Indian food I stopped in one day to give it a whirl, and I'm glad I did. I came back about once a month for the year or so I lived in SF. It's one of the few things I miss about San Francisco, actually.

Here's the thing: yes, Saffron Grill is a bit more expensive, but it's for a reason. The food is fresh, delicately flavored (but not at all bland or weak), and the ingredients are high quality. This makes a totally different dining experience than the quick and cheap places, although Saffron Grill is still quick when it comes to take out. The food tastes great and doesn't leave you feeling gross or comatose either.

The other reason I became a devotee is the service. Even though I was only in there about once a month, the family that runs it recognized me. I was always treated as more than just a customer or a walking wallet. They were friendly, curious, and made me feel welcome. Most of the time I'd get my food and we'd end up chatting for a while longer. That's my kind of service.

The bottom line is this: if you want cheap food, counter-service, and oil, go to Naan N'Curry, Pakwan (although see my other review on that place), Al Hamra, etc. If you want high quality food, friendly service, and to feel that warm, fuzzy feeling that comes after a healthy, flavorful meal, try Saffron Grill.

It'll cost you another couple of dollars a plate, but you won't be disappointed.
author: Nick H.

description:
Oh yum, oh yum, oh yum.  
We were uncommonly hungry for 5pm on a Saturday, and ethnic comfort food was to be found.  I'd been intending to try Saffron's predecessor, but being that they seem to have disappeared...  All this is quite ok by me, Saffron did me nothing but right!  The tamarind & mint sauces that accompany the while-you-wait cracker are clearly homemade, and I also sincerely hope they start bottling that stuff... that part alone gets 6 or 7 stars in my book!  The mint sauce has a bit of kick to it, the tamarind was tangy and sweet all at once... heavenly.  Truly.
Then came the totally unexpected samosas, which - yes - heart attack on a plate, and FREAKING TASTY.  I mopped up the remaining mint & tamarind sauces with mine.  Can't waste that stuff.  And I was tempted to ask for more sauce to go with my meal, but mattar paneer has lotsa sauciness already rocking for it.  And a rocking mattar paneer it was, too.  I could definitely taste the depth of spices, and was about ready to lick that bowl clean, too.  At last, Indian food that doesn't have a pool of grease floating atop!  Spinach naan to accompany my meal, and my date had chicken korma with kabuli naan.  He was less impressed with his meal, and that - coupled with the bizarre on-and-off attentiveness of the waitstaff, which I'll attribute to our 5pm seating - are the only things prompting me to knock off that 5th star.  I'll definitely be back.  Hopefully I can restrain myself from going back in within the same week.
author: Rachel S.

description: I checked out this place last night with a couple of my old coworkers. The staff and service was great and the restaurant has this rustic and quaint vibe. Good spot for dates. As for the food, I definitely loved it. The Samosa's appetizers were great. If you don't know what to get for an entree, try the Chicken Tikka Masala (Spicy) with Garlic Nan, please! You can never go wrong with this standard dish choice. If you are up for an adventure, try the Chicken Vindaloo or Butter Chicken. If you like spicy foods, this is as good as it gets. Be forewarned, don't ask for Spicy Vindaloo unless you like it really hot. The choice of Indian Beer is pretty good as well and the Mango Lassi drink is the bomb. For dessert top it off with the Gulab Jamun, the waitress recommended it and it was delicious. Fried doughnuts dipped in a cardamom flavored syrup is probably my new favorite dessert for 2009.
author: James M.

description: Yummy!! The staff is very nice and attentive and the food is great!! It's a pretty small spot, but they do well managing it.
author: Nathan J.

description: Easily my favorite Indian restaurant.  It is small, but don't let that fool you.  It always feels like I am going over to a friends house for dinner.  Warm and inviting.
author: Alaric F.

description: They take you late. That's cool, but when they take you late the food is not as good as usual... :( Most of the time, before ten, the food is good. nice n spicy.
author: Kerry D.

description: Best Saag Paneer dish I have ever had. It actually tasted fresh even though its cooked spinach. They make it possible here.
author: M. C.

description: Maybe I got a bad dish, but I figure anyone that can't make a decent Chicken Tikka Masala probably isn't the gold standard. Surprised with all the rave reviews about this place, but I've had better experiences at Clay Oven, India Palace, and even Naan & Chutney and NaaN & Curry.
author: Mike T.

description: I love this place! The food is seriously incredible, the staff are super friendly. It has become my favorite neighborhood restaurant. It's so unpretentious and friendly it's perfect after a hard day at work. I highly recommend the Chicken Achar it's their house specialty and I can see why!
author: Curtner J.

description: Saffron Grill has a lot going for it. We recently made a spur of the moment decision to try Saffron Grill and were pleasantly surprised. Despite the plain, almost hidden exterior and the cozy and humble interoir...the important parts were all spot on: the food and the service. The food was customizable in terms of spices which is a good thing for people like me and the service was fantastic. The folks that run this place are inviting, wonderful helpful (they gave us travel advice for our upcoming trip to India) and just nice people all around. This is a good choice.
author: Jason P.

description: This place is a neighborhood gem! The staff is so friendly and courteous and the place is so cozy. The chicken tikka masala is great, and so is the butter chicken. And the best garlic naan I have tasted in the city. The waitress always remembers me and she knows I order the same thing every time. It's very reasonably priced and the service is fast. If you live in the area, Saffron Grill is a must. And even if you don't live in the area, it's worth a visit!
author: Kelsey M.

description: OK at best. Butter Chicken was uninspired.  Sag Paneer was fresh, but only moderately spiced. Also, $28 is a bit much for two dishes, rice & naan.
author: Jameson B.

description: Amazing food and great service.  Came here on a Friday night and were lucky enough to grab the last open table.  The owners were attentive and so sweet!  Ordered the assorted appetizer with veggie samosas and pakora, which could probably be a meal in itself for one person.  Chicken tikka masala and Butter chicken entrees were brought out quickly.  Best quality meat I have had at any Indian restaurant and seasoned perfectly.  Big portions; tasted just as great the next night.  Will definitely be back.
author: Christina O.

description:
Last Friday I was really excited to see an Indian restaurant only a few blocks from my house, and it was absolutely packed so I figured it must be delicious.
I got take out from Saffron Grill last night and I have to say that it was really good, but different from any other Indian food I've ever eaten. We had the chicken tikka masala (a staple for me) and the aloo gobi. The tikka masala wasn't as creamy as I am used to. It was in a tomato base and was slightly sweet. The aloo gobi wasn't really a curry. It was cooked with curry spices, but it wasn't swimming in a lake of liquid decadence. Nothing was greasy and I felt like I might be eating something healthy for a change (not the feeling I typically get at Indian food restaurants). Also, the naan was unbelievable-slightly chewy, just how I like it. They have a really awesome-sounding lunch special, so I'm going to have to try that the next time I'm in my apartment come lunchtime.
author: Steffany F.

description: Ate there with 12 year old last night it was her first experience with Indian food so we had it mild.  It was just perfect. Ordered extra Nan because of the reviews and were able to take some home, great toasted in small oven for breakfast.  We had the 2 appetizers, tanduri shrimp (kids favorite) House special chiken (my favorite).  It wasn't until this morning that I realized "Indian food makes me sick"...But i wasn't sick I think because it wasn't greasy, and was light for Indian food.  We got there at 5 and parked right in front.
author: rassors T.

description: I've walked by this place numerous times and never tried it because the prices seemed a bit high for Indian food, but one night my boyfriend and I went and it was so good! The place is adorable, cozy, and small. The waitstaff is awesome and so friendly. The food is yummy and it's so close to my place. I'm glad I finally tried it out.
author: Pet O.

description: Eh. My friend always enjoyed this place more than I did but I think last night kind of killed it for her too. I don't really understand why we had to wait 45 minutes for lukewarm chicken vindaloo and fish masala when it seems like these would be pretty easy dishes to expedite. It kind of tasted like our food had just been sitting in the kitchen for a while. I also felt bad for the people waiting for their take out orders as they seemed to have called in way ahead of time. There's always been a wait for tables here and that's understandable during peak hours, but one way to alleviate this problem is to get the dishes out in a timely manner to promote turnover. Service could also be a little more efficient. I mean, the food is good, and it would be even better if it's served hot. The problem is that there are a lot of other really good Indian restaurants too and this used to be a place we'd go out of our way to go to, but I really wouldn't want to do that anymore.
author: Queenie C.

description:
We are new to San Francisco, so when I discovered this Indian restaurant 2 blocks away from our apartment- I was thrilled! We walked in and the waitress (the daughter, I think) acted like we knew each other for years. She was very laid back. It was a pretty small place and the atmosphere was very cozy. 

We ordered a bottle of wine- $20- for a good tasting bottle of wine! 

For dinner we ordered the samosas, chicken tikka masala, naan, rice, and my husband got the special- which was a full fish- crunchy and amazing on the outside and nice and soft on the inside. Everything was delicious! The spice (medium-plus) was also perfect- I love spicy but not too spicy. 

Great service. Great price. Great food. We will definitely be back!
author: D and I W.

description: I liked this place. Kabuli Nan was especially good as was the mango chutney and chicken masala. The tandoori chicken was too saucy for my preference and reminded me more of American chicken wings simply dipped in sauce. I would visit again.
author: Daniel R.

description: Just moved to the area...looking for a decent Indian place. Ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala - eh...not overly impressed.  The sauce was less creamy than I've had before and they dish skimped a bit on the chicken.  It wasn't horrible, but I will probably try other places in search for the perfect CTM. I only had the one dish so I can't speak to anything else in the restaurant - I also had takeout so ambiance wasn't an issue (although I found it odd that you needed a minimum order or $25 to deliver - coming from NYC they'd deliver for $10 or more...maybe it's a CA thing :-))
author: Nicole P.

description:
The food is amazing the service is great! 

We've been here a couple of times and have loved everything we've ordered. 

The lamb korma and chicken curry are the best!
author: Paul B.

description: what a cute hole in the wall place!  had a great time here with my co-workers :)  i recommend the chicken korma with garlic naan :)
author: Janice M.

description:
Saffron Grill serves the best Indian food my wife and I have ever had, and we've tried numerous Indian and Pakistani restaurants both in SF and the East Bay.

Rita is a gracious, friendly, and hip hostess who doesn't seem to be running  a restaurant as much as she's inviting you into her home.  We go every couple of weeks, and she and Ajeet always go out of their way to warmly welcome us.

The flavors of their dishes are delicately balanced and come with the right amount of fire (unless you request more, of course).  Nothing has been overwhelmingly heavy, overly creamy, or devastatingly spicy, which in most restaurants merely covers for a lack of imagination.    

This is the first Indian restaurant in which I've been able to discern a number of spices and fragrances within a single dish.  Their focus seems to be on balancing a variety of flavors in order to come up with innovative takes on traditional favorites.  We leave feeling awakened by the quiet intensity of well-thought flavors.

We are so grateful to have found this little local powerhouse, and we're always referring friends.
author: Deronius M.

description: The food was very good actually. I went on the first night it was open thinking it was the Kathmandu Cafe that used to be there, but it was a nice surprise, and not so spicy as to cause a stomach ache either. It's small and cozy on the inside, and it has wonderful traditional North Indian plates. The samosas were delicious, as well was the tandoori grill special with three types of meat. If you split it between two people it comes out to be pretty affordable. I especially liked their tamarind sauce, it's always one of my favorites. Naan was typically ok and not too filling, which was a plus. I'd definitely go back, there's not a whole lot of Indian places off Divis, most are in the Haight and Fillmore area and they're usually either too heavy or expensive.
author: Gina R.

description: The service here is amazing!! This restaurant has turned over three times since lived in this neighborhood but I hope this one is here to stay. The food is always comforting, rich and tasty! This restaurant has versatile atmosphere for people looking for a good meal or a cozy date!
author: Dawn S.

description: Finally a good Indian restaurant in my neck of the woods!!!  I went there for dinner the other night and was pleasantly surprised.  The tandoori chicken was great as was the nan, rice and dal.  If you like chai like I like chai, you won't be disappointed here...  and to top it off, the rice pudding made in house was fab!  The only downside was the lighting - it was way too bright in there - but that's no big deal since it's the food that really matters!  They can easily turn down the lighting to improve the ambiance.
author: J D.

description:
I'm a big Indian food fanatic and Saffron Grill has now jumped to the top of my list for go to Indian food in San Francisco.  

The flavors are great and they avoid the generic, cream-laden, bland pattern that plagues most of the Indian food establishments in the City.  I usually first try the Chicken Tikka Masala as a baseline at any Indian restaurant I go to -- its a good way to get a sense of how other things on the menu are going to go.  At Saffron Grill its great -- far more flavorful and nuanced than at other establishments.  The chicken is high quality and the sauce doesn't leave you feeling sick and obese after dinner.

Plus, its family run and the staff is incredibly nice.  Its a great affordable and flavorful addition to the NOPA area.
author: Darin S.

description:
what a cute, cozy little bundle of love this place is. 

the sag paneer and curry dish we ordered "medium spicy," but apparently in saffron grill language, that means "very spicy."  the food was *really* spicy!  consider ordering it "mild" if you actually want it medium spicy.

that is all.
author: Elle B.

description: I still love this place, but I've had take-out a couple of times that was pretty good, yet not incendiary (like the first time).  So I'm knocking off a star.  Still damn good.
author: shoo b.

description:
This is such a wonderful mom and pop restaurant.  The atmosphere is simple and clean while the service is prompt, effusive, and friendly.  Prices are really affordable, especially for the fantastic food.

Our waitress suggested dishes, which I always appreciate, and she was right on target.  The Sag Paneer was incredible as was the ginger tea.
author: Miranda J.

description:
I really wanted to like this place, but...

I usually order Channa Masala and Navratan Korma at Indian restaurants, because these are the two dishes that help me establish a baseline for quality and taste. I was disappointed because the flavors and aromatics were too mild in the Channa Masala and it wasn't saucy. And the cream and veggies in the Korma were not at all what I expected. A little bland, the veggies didn't seem fresh (maybe frozen?) and the cream wasn't thick enough. I just thought the food lacked what I have come to expect in Indian food--strong, bold, and flavorful, with aromatics to match. If I ever went back to this restaurant, I wouldn't order these dishes again. The dishes that our neighbors had looked quite good, however, so I would consider going back to order something else.

I am by no means a connoisseur, but I've been eating Indian food for quite a number of years and have pretty high standards when it comes to taste and quality, whatever type of food I'm eating. 

I'm not trying to bash this restaurant, so here are things I liked:

The service was good and attentive.
Tamarind chutney was to die for
The "medium" spice level was true, and not an "Americanized" version of spiciness
The atmosphere: I like how small and homey the place is
author: Jessica A.

description: The food, service, and atmosphere are excellent! All the dishes I have tried here have been so delicious and the employees are super friendly.
author: jane s.

description: Just had this again, and wanted to re-emphasize really good food! Get the pickled lamb dish. Such nice people (a family) run this place and the food really has that homemade feel. They always give great recommendations and they DELIVER. MMMMMMMMMMM
author: Lauren Q.

description: My girlfriend and I just ate here for the first time after it changed from the Kathmandu Cafe. The food was awesome! Everything that we ordered was delicious and I would order again. We'll definitely be going back. If you haven't been here yet, I recommend trying it. TASTEY!
author: Jesse G.

description: So many things going for this place:  it's around the corner from me, is intimate and comfortable, the food is amazingly good, and the hostess is a lot of fun.
author: Eric W.

description: Do yourself a favor and try this tiny gem of a restaurant. The family who works here (owns?) is so welcoming and friendly. They greet you with smiles which to me speaks volumes. Food is spectacular, try the vegetable pakoras. YUM!
author: emmie h.

description: How this place gets a 4-star average is beyond me.  Really.  The food is mediocre at best.  Other descriptors?  Blah, blase, boring, bland, and tasteless.  We ordered three dishes and all of them were dead on arrival.  The missus kept pouring samosa sauces on each of the dishes to give them some semblance of flavor.  The samosas were good, but samosas do not make a restaurant.   Skip this place, folks.
author: Mr. V.

description: I'm very happy to have this place in the neighborhood. We went in around 10:00pm and even though we were the last ones there, the staff was very kind and didn't make us feel rushed. The sauces were delicious and well executed. It's the kind of place you hope stays around for a long time.
author: Anthony C.

description: Have been going to the grill at least once a week for the last 6 months. always good!  recommend the chicken tikka massala. Very tasty
author: Greg S.

description: I found this place on google and considering all the good reviews it had, decided to give it a shot. Between me and my companion, we had the paneer shashlik and the prawns masala. The paneer was out of this world and very well made. The spice level was just perfect for us with the paneer being extremely soft and moist. Shrimps masala was also extremely well made, the shrimps were juicy and the curry tasted like it had been freshly made. All in all, a great experience and am sure to visit this place more often.
author: Pri S.

description: Living in SF, we're spoiled with so many good Indian restaurants. A friend who's from India recommended that I try this place.  He raves about the food here, so I figured it got to be good.  Cheeze, was I surprised, this place is not only good, it was the best Indian food I had in my life.  We ordered Chicken kabob, Onion Nan, Roti, Butter Chicken, Pawns Masala.  Rice pudding and mango smoothie completed our meal.  Everything was delicious!!! The friendly service makes it a perfect evening.  Saffron will be our place for Indian food from now on......
author: Kevin T.

description: I can't remember ever walking into a restaurant with such mouth-watering aromas hitting your face as soon as you open the door.  I had a great experience here and will definitely go back.  The chicken tikka masala and lamb achar were both amazing.  Service was extremely friendly.
author: Luke P.

description: i third-wheeled here for dinner last night and had an overall fab experience. i had never been to kathmandu cafe, so i can't compare the two. i was immediately impressed by the super friendly staff and eagerly awaited the meal to see if it matched up to the service. the naan and papadum were awesome to start off with. i tried the vegetable biryani and the sag paneer and asked for it to be medium hot. both were quite flavorful and def up there on the spicy scale. the chicken vindaloo received good reviews from my friend....def check this place out. although the decorating was a bit stark, i always love a good family restaurant vibe and they definitely had that goin on!
author: Alicia O.

description: We ordered food to go and it was wonderful! My wife, who normally isn't a fan of Indian food, really enjoyed it and wants us to go back soon!
author: Alan D.

description: food was good - the mixed vegetable curry had a fresh homemade taste, and none of the dishes we tasted were at all greasy. As an Indian living in the city, I return to very few places, nothing feels authentic. this was different. As the man so famously said, I'll be back!
author: Pia C.

description: We tried the lamb vindaloo, chicken tikka masala, saag paneer, veggie korma, naan,  and everything was wonderful! Each bite tasted as fresh and flavorful as the last. I highly recommend giving Saffron Grill a try.
author: Stacie R.

description: Wonderful specials tonight - lamb samosas, tandoori trout and okra bhindi were delights!
author: Geri S.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE. The food rocks. Great spicy green sauce. LOVE the main server - she makes you feel so at home and has a wonderful and easy laugh. I asked her how it is working with her father (he is the chef) and she said "entertaining"... Great answer :) Honestly, when I leave I feel like my batteries have been recharged. I would highly recommend it.
author: Amanda M.

description: Hurrah!  Good, cheap Indian food in the neighborhood!  Ever since moving from the South Bay I've thought that a relative lack of good Indian food was just about the only downside of living in SF.  Well, for me anyway, Saffron Grill takes care of that.  If you're looking for some tasty samosas on a random Wednesday night, and you're around Alamo Square or Divis, this is the place for you.
author: Conor S.

description: a little gem hidden in all of nopa!!! amazing..the place is small no frills but very clean n comfy n actually cozy...its right off divisadero on fulton..well dont know where to begin..ordered several dishes n asked for it to be in the above medium heat as far as spices go..well from the first dish to the last it was the most amazing..ordered the boneless chicken tandoori grilled sweet n savory the panner spinach amazing,the yellow beans yummy,the fritters..sweet n good...now dont even let me begin with hte naan..the garlic so yummy..well i cant wait to get back there n try the others on the menu..its great a family run biz,the father is the chef,formerly with gaylords n indian oven..daughter runs the front room along with her husband..can't wait till my next visit!!!! yummy.. ..ps. our young son had the mango lassy and said it was his best ever!  and he has tasted several from other indian rest...luv it there....try it u won't be disappointed...
author: kat r.

description: awesome service and tasty food.  definitely will bring me back for additional meals.
author: Tom L.

description: I loved the service, but the food is really, really bland. If you enjoy spicy Indian food, I would not recommend this place. I grew up eating Indian food and lived in India for a year, so I know I'm biased, but this food was seriously lacking flavor and spicing. We even ordered our food spicy, and I thought the fact that my boyfriend is obviously Indian (I'm half, don't look like it tho) would add some weight to our preferences. I can enjoy Indian food without it being spicy as long as there is some kind of flavor. Our vegetable biryani and saag paneer were cooked very well. No pools of oil, ingredients were fresh, colors were vibrant. The quality of the ingredients and how it was cooked made the fact that the food didn't taste like anything even worse. It could have been so good, but ended up failing. Prices are a little high, but I don't mind paying more for quality food. Next time I want more fancy Indian food, I'll stick to Sultan.
author: Rekha S.

description: Like everyone else who reviewed, I live in the neighborhood and enjoyed KC while it was here.  But to be honest, I much prefer Saffron Grill's menu over KC's due to the better vegetarian options (ie. paneer).  We've eaten here twice and the food has been good both times.  I love the fact that they serve Flying Horse beer, because it is by far the best Indian brew that I've found to date.  And the friendliness and sense of humor of our waitress this past visit made the meal that much better.  It is clearly a family run business, which is exactly the kind of business that I like to support.  During our most recent visit, my gf ordered malai kofta and asked for it 'extra spicy.'  The waitress gave her a crooked smile and a look that said "I like a girl who can handle her spice."  The outcome was perfect...much like someone else said...left you wanting more and calling uncle at the same time.  Support this local restaurant.
author: Lee M.
